FNdyTmcZjrDbeZEmgyouSQ.text: Looooooved this place the tenders are awesome and they have like 10 diff types of honey to drizzle over them (wasabi, chipotle, etc). The chicken livers and onions were also really good for those that like them.

7JTA6avDBRdYeTYNGkBqQA.text: Great wing, just enough seasoning and mild enough to enjoy. Ate at the bar and service was awesome. Employee treat you like family.

E-ihzpbqKB-IA6zZoH1hWQ.text: That bomb chicken!!! if you're in Vegas check this place out. If You don't know what to get just ask their staff and they will give you a good choice..

3qRtpynwqMSAPI-7FqXr5Q.text: So far the best fried chicken I've had in Las Vegas, and yes I've had some by others at higher prices who claimed to be the best.  Both dark meat and white meat.  Not much room inside the small place in the Great Bazaar shops, but service was quick and friendly.  Beer was good, cold, and generous too.  Nice selection of sauces (hot and/or sweet types) on the tables.

nLbVGKBLPFYM4nRcx_wSyA.text: Delicious fired chicken. I had breast, wing large slaw and cold beer. Awesome. The chicken spice was really good. I but bbq and honey wasabi sauce on side for dipping. So good. I highly recommend. I will be back. Please open one of these joints in San Jose you will make a killing.

VCVCKwjZ3dHBKF-1VKFs4w.text: They got our order wrong and the food wasn't soo great. But they did give me a side of fries for the inconvenience.

RJPbgn1pMYONoIBW7gh0Eg.text: Chicken was just ok. Good flavor, but just didn't have that crispy fried chicken texture. Fries were really good.  Skinny and crispy with lots of flavor. The price was kind of expensive...$10 for 2 small drumsticks and fries.  Disappointing.

sC8m-eeUMzIW0np6BwynuA.text: Best fried chicken and fries I've ever had! Huge sandwiches! Delicious sauces! Smoky barbecue is my favorite. Great coleslaw! Friendly staff, little wait time, and great food. This is our new go-to spot before a night of drinking in Vegas! Also... fantastic music: retro, 80s pop type!

m7cly11-dWPT__2ZcyGMbg.text: I like this place so much that I looked for it on Yelp to leave a review. I've been ordering from Postmates for a couple of weeks and this is definitely the best fried chicken I've ever had in Nevada I've been here 19 years I've never had better Fried Chicken. The portions are gigantic the crust is delicious the chicken is moist and high-quality. No question this is one of the best fried chicken places. This is the kind of place that you eat at and then you tell your friend hey you have to try this. I couldn't imagine someone would eat this fried chicken and give it only three stars. I actually read the negative review to see what they were even talking about. I don't review a lot if you look me up you'll be able to see but when I do it's usually great. My mom said if you can't say something nice don't say anything.  this place I have to say something because it really is fresh high-quality amazing food.

Yc0uKcgtv-6Pwqk9cIUu3Q.text: We stumbled up on this spot while walking down the strip and the food was good.  I enjoyed the chicken strips and fries.  Good flavor and many other good choices. Only 2 chicken strips though, need to add 1 more to make this meal complete. the service was good also.

d4n73I34-WF-WstHc2X6Cw.text: First place my girlfriend and I ate with some friends when we got to Vegas, got a recommendation to check this place out for their chicken. Order the chicken sandwich and the girlfriend got the two piece chicken plate. cole slaw was okay, chicken itself was moist and juicy, not dry at all. sandwich was delicious, the sauces were delicious you can fill your little cups. overall pretty good for what it is. Would definitely recommend.

TNvxySoQKejfxMxAVTg-Nw.text: Had a really bomb fried chicken sandwich!  Service was quick and friendly.  We ended up sitting at the bar.  Great choice!  Tiffany, the bartender, was AMAZING!  Even though we didn't order a alcoholic drink, she was friendly and helpful!  She brought our food, gave us ranch, cleaned our table, and chatted us up.  How refreshing!  Thanks Tiffany for making our first stop in Vegas a great one!

4_YVn84K06xz9j757ZgZKw.text: Just okay for me. Does not pack a good crispy crunch, but has good seasoning. Popeyes chicken is 100x better.

DcRw023xJ8RP3zRUHm45eA.text: The chicken here is gross soggy yet still over breaded.I don't get the high rating!? Chick fil a and canes are much better for half the price.i won't be back. Over priced .

-bISGsFgxbwHWEOgtgep8g.text: Yummy! This was great,  lots of flavor and friendly staff.  I have a sensitivity to eggs and the staff and the manager knew what was in the coleslaw and followed up once I got my order to make sure I was enjoying the meal.  Also,  the chipotle honey on their chicken is amazing!

OD6LgGF-pwXmqlSKt-1Gww.text: Stopped here after a night strolling the Strip. Mainly because it was one of the only places open. A bit pricey but the chicken was actually pretty good. Beverages could have been better as this place doesn't offer Coke or Pepsi products but an alternative that has Cane Sugar if I'm not mistaken.  The sauces available to put on your chicken is pretty good, lots of variety. Try the Chipotle one, it was my favorite of them all. There is plenty of space to eat as you can also sit outside if you want some fresh air. Once order is placed there is a short wait to pick up your food. Just about enough time to find a seat and sample your beverage. Overall, it's Vegas and it's on The Strip so it's overpriced but when it's after Midnite, your options are limited.

9jo1wvcUQX6u4i6scUayvA.text: Nothing special I ordered the blue cheese chicken sandwich and fries which came to about 11or12 bucks and my wife had two chicken wings and fries for like 8 bucks personally I thought KFC or Popeyes had more flavor and seasoning in their chicken so  not sure what the hype is. I think it's a bit overpriced for the taste of the food. I saw that an 8pc with 2 sides was $40, like really? Service was slow but they were probably making the food by order

Np5OSt3ps6TyLbkXxtaosQ.text: The fire bird chicken sandwich was awesome.  We also had sweet potato fries and coleslaw very good!  The staff was very friendly and the bar tender was so much fun!  She was awesome with her megaphone!

C7L-ixVGzypKPSjNBuZCBA.text: Good chicken sandwich. Like everything in Vegas, it is expensive. One order of fries is enough for multiple people.

_1K2frUBIerAOT8lITfWCQ.text: The chicken wings were good but may friend has the tenders and she said they were excellent. They come with some type of seasoning which is very tasty. And there are multiple sauces you can choose from as dips  one down side is you can only get regular fries with your order unless you upgrade for an additional price and the prices are already quite high for my taste, but hey it's Las Vegas so I guess it's to be expected!!  What I enjoyed the most was the Last Vegas Lemonade. This drink is a must!!  I believe it's made with lemonade and Kentucky Burbon.  Again, if you are a drinker this is definitely the drink for you.

S6F47VpEMNGY6iT54Bw5EQ.text: Ok. Full disclosure- I have been eating fried chicken of all sorts my entire 1/2 decade plus two on this planet (you do the math!). This was the most disappointed meal I have had. Let's start with it is basically a fast food joint. Don't look for a eating experience when going here. I wasn't. I know I was eating at place connected to a hotel in Vegas so you expect prices to be expensive but 4 wings and fries for $22! No, that is just ridiculously and over priced. The lines were not to long and your order came up no faster than that from a Popeye or KFC. I don't like coleslaw which come with the wings so I asked to substitute for Mac-N-Cheese, nope! Can't do it! Really? Why Not? At those prices I should be able to switch. So I ended up with an extra order of fries!  Ok. This review is not about the prices but about the smallest wings I have gotten from a established business whose only food is chicken. I wish I had a ruler so you can see how small they were. They had to be lowest grade wings. Then to top it off they were bland. I know your asking yourself how? with all that season salt in the flour, but the chicken itself was not seasoned first. They had so much seasoning in the flour it began to burn, you'll notice that on the pictures. Good chicken is fried to golden brown and when buttermilk is added it might get a little red but not burnt. Not a good experience. Tables nasty and sticky, even when lines died down no one came out to clean. No one picked up trays or wiped down tables or swept floor, you get at least that at any fast food place. Save your money and get some good wings at the other million places that serve wings on the strip.

MTvV3o6h9pzgC_sC6JdwQw.text: One of the best darn chicken sandwiches ever !  I ordered the cheesy supreme and added smoked bacon! Chicken was cooked to order and was served piping hot with oooey gooey melted cheddar and American cheese, with what seemed like a marinated beefsteak tomato, house made pickled cucumbers , fresh shredded lettuce and a delicious (egg?) bun, and thick cut smoked bacon, perfection !! The fries were piping hot and good , but maybe a thicker cut as an option as they cooled off fast and became crunchy and cold ! While hot they were delicious once cold I threw half away , same for the sweet potato fries, the coleslaw was bland and vinegary ! The real star is the chicken !! Maybe get sides at wahlburger or one of the other restaurants in the bazaar shops?  But I would definitely go back just for the chicken and chicken sandwiches !!

Fire bird sandwich filled with lettuce peppers spicy mayo cucumbers and tomatoes  it wasn't to spicy you felt the heat when you took a bite of the peppers and the cucumbers gave it a cooling effect, I added hot sauce to mine. Everything fries, had cheese bacon and sour cream. Mac and cheese and a chicken strip so we could try all of the different honey flavors. Definitely recommend and I can't wait to go back

We ordered the fries with bacon and cheese which was definitely worth it!!! My only feedback would be I would prefer a thicker and crispier coating on the chicken. Overall an awesome menu!

OQcKZBzB_oKojPie4ez8HQ.text: My new Fried Chicken FAVORITE!  OK so my hubby and I came into the strip on Saturday night and had parked at Bally's (note: it's not free parking-we paid $7 for a few hours)  Anywhoo with no intention of going out to eat, we saw this shop on the way down the escalators and thought why not as we'd heard great thing about it from the Yelp Elite crew that went (I missed out)  And I'm so glad we did!   We weren't starving - so I ordered the 1 wing and hubby got the thigh or was it breast... whatever it was he loved it. Thick and juicy - lol!  I love love the seasoning and my wing was perfect and moist too!   With it I ordered the Moscato and Modelo 24oz can and we were set!   Food was FABULOUS! Service was SENSATIONAL!  Staff were spot on service and you weren't standing around guessing. They were all very cool!   Thank you! We'll be back for sure!

strSfj-L96ePkYj-O0cqyA.text: Holy batman! We learned about this place from IG which is crazy considering how many times we have hung out on the strip. The chicken is moist and tender and the side are amazing. We got a side of fries with the works. I love that the French fries are shoestring which makes each one crunchy. It was topped with sour cream, cheddar cheese and bacon. So rich and decadent. I got a side of hush puppies which were salty with a crunchy exterior and soft middle. So good! We got the Blue Ribbon and Rancher chicken sandwich. We both loved our sandwiches which came with a soft bun, lettuce a house made pickle and, of course, a juicy piece of boneless fried chicken. The portions were huge so we basically left in a food coma. You must try if you are on the strip. You will not be disappointed. I promise.

vk48HQQ10yKlxyuBdsuTzg.text: I came here for a late midnight snack/dinner since they were open until 2am. I'm glad it was still open because it satisfied my savory cravings. I ordered the chicken wings with fries. The outer skin of the wings were crispy which is the way I love my wings. Fries were thinly sliced and soft. All went well with the Chipotle honey sauce: sweet with a kick of spice. I am taking 1 star away because there were napkins and garbage on the floor when I walked into the restaurant. I believe all restaurants should maintain a level of cleanliness, even if they are considered fast food restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WlFpVMooD6PIZxqFG3rowg.text: Wow. I was shocked!  I don't usually eat fried ANYTHING but I took a chance and had the chicken sandwich with caramelized pineapple and HOLY CRAP IT WAS YUMMY!!!!  The staff was nice and the bartender fun. What the place lacks in atmosphere, it feels a bit like a fast food joint in more than makes up for with the food and people.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken sandwich with caramelized pineapple YUMMY

0aXY9MYKg4CaxnovHX2fpA.text: Visiting from out of town, looking up the popular local spots when I came across blue ribbon. Traveling with family we ordered the obvious choice- family style! We were all content with the portion sizes. The fried chicken was moist and nice flaky crunch crust. Mac and cheese would be my favorite. SUPER CHEESY! I was not a fan of the hush puppies, ridiculously dry. Didn't think it was accommodating that refills were an extra fee. Other than that it was a great visit. Don't think I'd go again but def recommend stopping in to try their food.

zPgn4AcO4EZyvsBVRmPtXw.text: Bummed.  Not the same menu and not the same style place at all.  Came in for the salad or sandwich I used to get....no more.  Just a fancy popeys

LpP4fb6tKdxkYsTIDZo7rg.text: Pretty dang good fried chicken ! The chipotle honey was a nice touch. It was a Nashville style fried chicken .  Several sauces to choose from. Attached to Bally's casino with outside or inside seating. The blue ribbon sandwich was good too.

lFZGkhMzq5FciH1vaP_9YA.text: You know it's a good sandwich when you have more chicken then bread lol.  The chicken was juicy, fresh and filling. The bread was soft and light. The toppings were cut fresh and the pickle tasted homemade.  Add a side of sweet potato fries and cole slaw for $2.  They are definitely known for their juicy chicken but their honey based sauce selection tops it off. Wasabi Honey and Chipotle Honey were my favorite. You will walk away perfectly full and satisfied.  Only downside is the drinks are not refillable the milkshake tasted like soft serve but was pricey.  Just go for the chicken!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the Blue Ribbon and the Panino

DjEyBATCovzscGFqcF7hgw.text: Every time I visit this place I'm blown away by the quality of their food and service. Having never been a fan of fried-chicken *gasp* outside of a chicken finger basket Blue Ribbon won me over with their crispy skin and juicy interior.   The Firebird is one of my favorite sandwiches. You can win me over with any variation on a chipotle sauce. I am also a big fan of their Kale Salad. I was a bit wary of it because just about everyone is doing a kale something or other on their menu. The salad was a nice mix of healthy crunch with the fried chicken I was enjoying.  The food comes out fast, they serve Boylan natural sodas, and cocktails on draft. Their draft beer selection is a nice mix of national and local and might I recommend the Hazelberry boozy milkshake. It's a blend of Nutella and Chambord.   I have yet to visit this location into the wee hours, but they are open until 2am. As if that's not reason enough to give this place five stars!

lAnEQ6KM2gqy7CBskY6nYg.text: I was walking the strips of Las Vegas, cold and despondent, the dinner my friend and I had just barely registering as actual food when lo and behold, we saw a sign for fried chicken near the LINQ, that boring spinning wheel thing that's supposed to be fun but is really, really boring and has terrible views. Anyways, back to the fried chicken. There was a sign for it, we were hungry, we walked in and BAM, this place kicks ass for fried chicken! You can get individual pieces...like leg, breast, whatever your thang is. Their coleslaw was perfectly slawed and crispy and the fried skin on the chicken...blows KFC out of the water. If you're craving late night fried chicken, this is the place to go!

bEn3VVzGUlpQZ9qCuWboMg.text: I hate giving a 2-star review. Majority of the deduction is due to the fact that I waiting around 30-minutes for 1-thigh and 1-drumstick. That's only 2 pieces of chicken. Went around 9:00PM and although there were several orders ahead of me, there was always chicken that was available that I saw on the rack. I'm not sure if orders are done in actual order, so I had to wait for them to come to mine. But if an order is small, such as mine, I'd think you'd get to that and move on to the next one.  I really wanted to try this place, since I heard the chicken was pretty good. And although I'm not going to say the chicken is junk, I wasn't wowed or ever thought to myself that I'd really want to come back because the flavor was unique or something I'd crave. To me, it was a one and done type of thing. And I hate saying that of any business. Flavor was good, but that's about it. Maybe the pieces that I had were flavored inconsistently? I'm not sure. But I did notice that a seasoning is shaked onto the chicken. Maybe mine wasn't addressed as much. And that's all that I think. Just so-so in flavor. Perhaps I *might* give them another chance, but only if I'm around the area.

DWHRuGiBkrn3RSTtGfNj4g.text: Pretty good for late night eating. I had the blue bird and it was awesome. Blue cheese crumbles for days so if you don't like the BLUE, then don't get it. Great air conditioning and tasty fries. Will definitely return when in Vegas.

01RZG6UsOq8wVPpLQ406EQ.text: We happened to walk by Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken while walking down the strip.  We already had dinner earlier and it wasn't quite time for a snack but I had to stop and try it.  I ordered a kid's meal with a strip and fries and a chicken wing.  It wasn't busy so our trip was ideal.  My husband and I sat down at a communal table.  The table has a collection of bbq sauces and honeys.  We taste tested all of them.  Chipotle honey was my favorite.  The strip was good, I had a bite and my husband finished the rest.  The fries were good too.  My favorite though was the wing.  It was tender and tasty.  It had more flavor than the strip.  The batter is light, crispy, and not greasy.  The problem is I only had one but I sure did enjoy it.  Next time in Vegas, I'm having more than one wing.

p6Zgk-CefGt-SvzRDbzWfQ.text: This is becoming my bad habit. Ordering the chicken tenders allows me to sop up all the Chipotle honey sauce I desire, without being asked to leave. This makes a great cheat meal if you're on some sort of calorie-restricted diet.

V6WeSpqp2TJxwk_G6Uf_zw.text: I love fried chicken and this place definitely hit the spot. Even in 107* Vegas heat. This place is on the Strip so prices are definitely high, but the pieces were perfectly crispy, crunchy and just a hint of spice. We actually went twice on the trip. Once at 1:30AM for a late snack.  Lots of great sauces to choose from too so you can change up each bite. Definitely worth a shot if you're just on the corner of Flamingo and LVB and standing in front of Ballys.

rAPsx0T0AEkm4pqFU59y7Q.text: Ordering is fast. But long wait. Waited 30 min for our food. Order was so disorganized. I don't get why. Order was messed up. Just for tender and fries... didn't get the fries. Friend got a burger which was cold. Not coming back.

SUL54outZSPGQ2EZ1xXZew.text: I recently discovered this place on the strip & it was so good, I loved everything about it the food was nice & warm and also the staff was great especially Alexis he was very handsome & sweet he deserves a raise!

The chicken wasn't too salty but the right amount of salty. The food was amazing and simple and I would eat this everyday if I could!

Kw6fT7C1gG3836nr2mzr2Q.text: I remember the good old days when LA eatery, Golden Bird, was the best chicken ever.  Well there's a new chick in town, and Blue Ribbon Chicken is it.  Haven't had this good of a time getting my yardbird on in ....never.  Wow!

dNjGRf2AhQZ4DRbYV6qtjA.text: Nothing else like it on the strip. Each bite of my chicken sandwich came off super neat. Plus it's tasty. A classic chicken sandwich was super tasty.

KWTVVPnWigR9pwJ1SQLzOg.text: On a hot October afternoon, I was wandering the strip for some lunch and came across Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken near Bally's hotel. I ordered the Blue Ribbon Chicken Sandwich and it was so goood. The chicken was both crunchy AND tender (after trying so many fried chicken places, I realized how hard it is to make fried chicken that is both juicy and crunchy) and it went perfectly with the tomatoes, cucumbers, and lettuce. There's also a variety of original sauces and honeys that paired with the chicken very well like the chipotle honey, wasabi honey, wildflower honey, and blue ribbon bbq sauce. If I am ever craving a chicken sandwich on the strip, this is definitely the spot.

959H2KpbhT5y5RWLgnj65A.text: Fried Chicken... It's hard to mess up and a cheaper option then what is in the casinos.  Blue ribbon sandwich, yum!

EV4ZuisrXhpuo5BcRH1NrQ.text: I've read many good reviews and I had to try it.  I enjoy good fried chicken and this was good.  I noticed that they added extra dry spicies after they fried the chicken which I found interesting.  Clearly, it gave the chicken more flavor.  The real trick was the sauces.  The mix of sauces and the added spicies made the difference.  It was pricey but this is Vegas. The staff was helpful. I have no complaint.  It is worth a try if you enjoy fried chicken.

awqRO3CN1oaF-l7_a81IKg.text: Came here twice over the weekend because this chicken is pretty bomb. Plus there are different sauces you can add to give it more flavor etc. Half of the sauces are some sort of honey and there are n two hot sauces which aren't really hot. A line forms at night time, but in the day time the service is fairly fast.

3KgH2T8l4Xi8clogCWjd2Q.text: Eating at Blue Ribbon was one of those life changing experiences!! I never realized that fried chicken could be so crunchy and juicy at the same time! I was amazed....!  At first I thought the place was a bit expensive for fried chicken and boy was I wrong! The chicken was cooked to perfection. I think there were 15 of us and I was amazed to see how fast they served it up and how consistently perfect it was!  The sauces.. oh my! At first I was taken aback by the chicken but once you start trying the sauces, it blows your mind even more! RIDICULOUS!

2QiyF5PGHHsB7t3Bt8vROg.text: I had some really high expectations of this place after reading Yelp reviews.   I ordered by the piece and got the wing and drumstick and the pickled cucumbers. My friend got the 2 piece tender meal and the mac and cheese.  My food came out really quick, but my friend waited 30 minutes for her food. The seasoning on the chicken was really good but the skin was super soggy and definitely had a "been sitting for a while" feel to it. Pickled cucumbers however were bomb.   My friend said her tenders were super dry but we agreed the fries and mac were really good. I probably wouldn't get the chicken here again but would go for the sides.

J56nuih0gPJKvgp739fh0g.text: Loved this place, walked by and saw the chicken and had to eat here. This was the best fried chicken I have ever ate. Please stop by this place you will not be disappointed. The service and friendliness of staff was the cherry on top . Kudos to this hidden gem .

nGK7VifLxaQdtnzrjzttog.text: The fried chicken was delicious! Perfectly fried; juicy inside and crispy outside with a little dry spice on it giving it great flavor. I had the 2 piece dark meat. The breast was a little small, but it didn't stop the flavor. The combo came with a bunch of fries, which were also very good. I had a side of the smoked Mac n cheese that was excellent. All in all it was very delicious food but $12 for 2 small pieces of fried chicken and fries is way too steep to be a 5 star spot. But a great option in the area.

ZMy078n9e0zanK8_3E06Uw.text: Quality seems to have really went down. I've only been here once since the move from Summerlin. Just wasn't the same. Probably will not be coming back.

H84aO-nKv8QANHHBkvQBeg.text: I've booked marked this place on Instagram a few years ago and was pretty disappointed that they didn't have chicken sandwiches. But giving it 4 stars bc the chicken tenders was pretty good and moist. My sister ordered the Mac and cheese and fries and that was pretty good. Would definitely go back for the Mac and chicken tenders

iQY5oJgQOmysng16gz2ykg.text: I heard about the chicken here and how I had to try it! It did not disappoint. Definitely not the best chicken I've had and it was a little pricey but it was good! The loaded fries helped too! The only real disappointment with this location is the size. It was packed and everyone was crammed.. but hey, IT'S VEGAS! What do you expect! If in town visiting definitely check them out... great comfort food for those... um "late" nights

do0L-286oY9KlDyFcSrtEQ.text: As a huge fried chicken aficionado, I'm giving this place 5 stars, 10 out of 10, for checking all the boxes for me: crispy, non-greasy skin lightly battered and spiced, very juicy and flavorful meat.  You can taste the freshness in every bite, not the thick batter, grease and overpowering hot sauce of other fried chickens.   I would say it tastes like Church's Chicken but with loads more flavor!

wlArNMrfAMw7BfGV2JyFow.text: One of the reasons I flew out to Vegas was for blue ribbon chicken wings... last time I came and had them and fell in love!!! It's so crispy and juicy and seasoned so perfectly, makes you wanna lick up the tray they serve it on!! BOMB MUST TRY IF IN VEGAS... can y'all come to DENVER with it please!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UaBqTz6j4a2SNfBqGI1K-w.text: They got some GoOoOoOod Fried Chicken!   For lunch, dinner or a fourth meal (late night) cause it's open till 2am. This place will satisfy you in all the right places, if you like fried chicken that is.   Located in the grand bazaar near the escalator to Bally's there is an area with outside seating and a walk up bar that has a small selection of beers and cocktails, there's also indoor seating not much though probably 30 people max. The (Hot Mary) bloody mary it's the shiznit by the way, the mary has organic habanero vodka and a ton of horseradish - OoooWeeee it's good. For the chicken you can get one piece or a few. Blue Ribbon serves up thighs, breast pieces, whole wings, drumsticks, tenders, necks, liver, gizzards etc. I would not recommend wasting your money on the whole wings, they are skimpy on the meat you will not be satisfied. The breast pieces are a good size, two would fill you up. There is a good selection of sauces for the chicken like wasabi honey, wild flower honey, bbq, chipotle honey and habanero. I would recommend this place for sure and will return when I want fried chicken in Viva Las Vegas..

My partner in crime went for the The pit (bbq chicken sandwich with bacon) and I got The Rancher ( chkn,bcn,Ranch?) We both agreed the chicken needed a little bit more flavor as it seemed all the chicken for sandwiches is pre-made and just they just add different sauces according to each sandwich. On my sandwich there was hardly any ranch. Overall we gave our sandwiches a C+. At least the soda( fountain drink) was good.   Side note:some sauce bottles were clogged.

vEqUnBtKalZeXDRQa9j6kw.text: This is some good chicken. Popeye's who? We landed and checked into the room and came out to get some lunch. Coming down the escalators of Bally's, you'll see the Blue Ribbon sign. My brother and I both said we heard this was good, so we ate here.  We got the 4 piece mix - Wow, nice seasoning and the breast meat was actually moist. Plenty of skinny fries. I wasn't a fan of the cole slaw though...needs work too me.  We came back the last day of our trip and ended up getting the 6 piece wings. Nice size and still yummy!  Would definitely be back!

ZqCYqdHmpRtDtY3fQLJlwA.text: Oh yeah, I'm giving Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken a solid 5 stars just for being open till 2am in the morning. But it's really all about their fried chicken. I've had Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken before at Brooklyn Bowl and I still believe to this day that it's my favorite Fried Chicken ever! So it was no-brainer for me to stop by their new eatery at the Grand Bazaar Shops which was conveniently located at Bally's where I was staying. I came in late night at around 1am. Although I was tempted to try their sandwiches, I was really in the mood for their fried chicken so I got their 4-piece combo meal that came with fries and coleslaw. 4-Piece Combo Meal -- bit.ly/2lhtUAn Sooo gooood! The chicken was fried perfectly with crispy skin and had a ton of flavor. Plus the sauces were totally enhanced the flavor, especially the wasabi honey. It's just as good as their chicken from Brooklyn Bowl, but minus the table service and the bowling. I definitely plan on coming back to Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken again next time I'm in Vegas to try their sandwiches which all look awesome! And for sure, I'll be back again for another round of their Fried Chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4-Piece Combo Meal -- comes with fries and coleslaw.  Sauces are (l to r) honey, wasabi honey, bbq.  Sooo gooood!

It's like if you combined fries from in n out and Wendy's.  Also have to give a huge shoutout to the manager and crew. Our food was 15 mins late and they gave us 2 extra wings, 4 huge strips, drinks and an order if fries for free!!

It comes in a very small container and doesn't match the portions of the other items. Keep it up!

UXbSZ0RCbZ9xbhYeXPz5MA.text: Had very high expectations for this place after reading thru the reviews. It was not terrible but it was very different. I ordered the Wing Supreme. Instead of the cole slaw I added extra fries which came at no additional cost. The fried wings were cooked well. The breaded was very light and not crunchy. After the wings came out of the fryer you could see the cooks add seasoning. The seasoning was half way decent, but had a little sweet taste which made it unique but nothing spectacular. The fries on the other hand were excellent. Crunchy and cooked well done. The bartender was offering samples of the in house cocktails. They were surprisingly tasty and contained a good portion of alcohol. This place didn't live up to the hype, but it wasn't a bad place. I am very selective with my fried chicken, so I would still recommend this place!

Ordered 1x blue ribbon sandwich. The sauce overpowered the chicken for sure. It was too flavorful and really cut back the star of the sandwich. The chicken was for a lack of a better word, skinny. You can see in the photo. Might give this place another shot next time I'm in town. I do want to try their chicken only!

UEeup-lTpm49JAFD4Ccp9Q.text: This chicken is bomb! Well seasoned, crispy, comes out quick and hot. The French fries were tasty and I loved their homemade dips. The give you free coleslaw, I wasn't a fan but to be fair I don't really like coleslaw. I didn't try the other sides but they looked tasty as well. HEFyS4ciUPg2GByVTgRidA.text: Came here after wandering for food after visiting the Flamingo because of the smell! Mmmmm! Crispy golden fried chicken?! Sign me up! It was crowded but the wait was short and my wife and I were able to find seating easily. The missus ordered the pulled bbq chicken sandwich and smoked mac n cheese and I ordered the 3 tenders meal which comes with fried and coleslaw. We found our seats facing Giordanos, which was next to the sauce bar. After filling up some ketchups, bbqs and chipotle honeys (oh what?!) had a seat and waited to cluck out. Around 10 minutes or so and my wife's bbq pulled chicken sandwich is ready. Mmmm! We split this (we usually split our meals) and I gotta say the BBQ sauce was amazing! Like a honey bbq. Completely sauced all over the chicken! 'Slaw is smothered on top of that. Tasty but beware of bones. My and I caught a few. So after I finish my half, I'm snacking on my wife's smoked Mac n cheese, which actually melted the fork it was so hot. It was plan and unsmokey, but ok. Alright, so it's been about 20 minutes and still no meal for me. Hmmm? 25 minutes later, I got my order but guess what. It was my whooole order. My three tenders, plus another bbq chicken sandwich meal! I said we couldn't eat that, and they said they would just toss it so I turned that negative into a positive, had em bag it up and found the first hungry person I could on The Strip. Alright so back to my chicken. It was good, seasoned lightly but still had taste. Yes this white guy needs his chicken seasoned AF. The honey chipotle was a nice touch but I could have used time honey mustard as well. If the wait between my wife's and my meals wasn't so long, and the ordered not askew, it would have got one more star.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauce and honey bar on either ends of restaurant

Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My meal I received almost 30 minutes after my wife&#39;s. I was so hungry I forgot to take a pic of the whole entree. Apologies.

4TJy_XJjhC3A4vp8x2p2ag.text: Read many reviews, which were all positive. Decided to give it a try and definitely did not disappoint. My husband ordered the chicken strips which were really tasty and he also ordered the double cheese chicken sandwich both were really good but if I had to choose I would definitely order the sandwich again. I got the plain chicken sandwich with the sauce and it was soo good, the sauce is delicious  we also ordered fries by itself and with the whole works they were absolutely amazing, their like shoe sting fries would recommend if you are in Las Vegas! I had sweet potatoes fries and they were shoestring and delicious. The smoked Mac and cheese was very good also. My husband had the boo bird and wished the onion rings on the sandwich were on the menu.

-P-lVpLT48JotEBWmWFKVA.text: Seriously the best chicken sandwich ever. How can something so simple be so good?  The seasoned breading is so good and of a great consistency. I prefer my chicken sandwiches to be of a thinner cut with lots of crispy breading and this completely fit the bill.  The shoestring fries are fantastic. I'm not big on fries and I don't usually order them but I ended up eating half of my husband's  (whoopsie). They have Boylan soda which is ok, but I'm a Coke girl. I loved this place so much I had it 2 of my 4 nights in Vegas. We had a nice dinner at Buddy V's one night, but to be honest I was just as happy with this chicken sandwich :) They also had a container for serve yourself complimentary water, which seems to be a rarity in Vegas. Great food, great service, reasonable prices. Loved it!

58iZtGRe66vy3WsZXL7lHw.text: It's a go to spot whenever I've visited the strip the last couple of years. Tasty chicken, love the flavor of the battery they use, open until 2 AM; expect it to be a little messy in there going in that late, but the chicken is still delish. The  Firebird sandwich is good or share a 4 piece with someone.

bWgEsR2gK9amL-5u2Xmp5Q.text: Great fried chicken. Truly a gem on the strip. Fried chicken is one of my favorite foods and this place is open late. Around $10 for 2 pieces of juicy crispy chicken and shoestring fries. Don't skip the hot sauce!

0WlQVG-mVMGNteByJiX_RQ.text: Not impressed... but then we weren't hungry either, we just wanted to try it.   Service was super slooowww, and from the time we walked in, 2 employees (could have been mgmt or owners) were chatting with a patron & didn't move an inch.  Meanwhile, our 2 strips & 1 drumstick took about 10-15 minutes to come out... AND this is a fast food type of joint.  I mean, we appreciate getting hot, fresh food, but when others are standing around doing nothing while the kitchen is backed up??!!  Not cool.    The drumstick was decent & well seasoned... the strips were whack!  They do have unique sauce options, but the chicken should be the star, not the sauces.   Wouldn't come back.

The agents were very attentive and respectful. The restaurant was very clean and smelled delicious. The manager AJA was EXTREMELY nice and caring. B4SCOsVA3eJoRc7kNRzhlQ.text: I stayed at Ballys and the Grand Bazaar was right outside. I initially went for Wahlburgers but saw this place and definitely wanted to check it out. Which I did the following day for lunch. I got the drumstick and thigh meal and my wife got the chicken tenders meal. There was a lot of quantity on the food and the sauce options are intriguing (I like the wasabi honey) but truth be told, the chicken was amazing on its own. Succulent and juicy. Some of the best fried chicken I've ever had. The inside is nice with a couple tvs and ample seating. There is a water dispenser and a fancy trash can. I nice place to just chill and eat if you are on the strip and don't want a fancy restaurant.

PdDh626lMG2puFp6QhFfYA.text: We attended the 2018 SEMA show this past week and I researched a few eating spots before leaving South Florida. What this place lacks in size it more than makes up for in service and flavor. The staff was very kind and very helpful. I love spicy food but the gentleman at the register kept me from killing my night by suggesting that I get the ghost sauce on the side other than on my delicious chicken sandwich, which in turn saved my night. That sauce was hot as hell, but I did love it in small dosages. If you happen to be on the Vegas strip, stop by this little fried chicken joint, you won't be sorry.

Emz7MeTSv4_xnR5rGtwboA.text: Was disappointed. I have had this place many times back in New York and it is always very good. I got the fried chicken strips and they were crispy but not flavorful at all. Another person in our group of 7 got the same as I did and said the same thing. The fries seemed to be very greasy and not crunchy. Also, the place is a little dirty. The chicken was very moist! The staff there was very very friendly. The prices are also a little high. Cost about 16 for 2 tenders. They do have different flavored honey, recommend the chipotle one. Others in my group got the chicken sandwich and said it was good and moist but again little flavor. Is open till about 2 am which is very nice. Overall not a bad experience just not like that of what I am used to.

e50QVa8ceq61Mb2jn_BYLw.text: Great dinner.  The fried chicken is delicious. The place was so busy and it took so long to get a tabbed are the only negatives. Pricey,  but worth it.

PnvnudcdpZq3os1n0-JYLg.text: We walked in here totally randomly while touring the strip. I was slightly buzzed off frozen margaritas at the time. The counter girl was extremely sweet and helpful. When I looked around the place, I thought it looked cute, clean, modern, yet homey.  The food is very reasonably priced for Vegas. 5 bucks for a chicken breast and 10 bucks for a drumstick combo. The amount of fries we got with the combo was enough for two people as well.  But the chicken... oh lord the chicken..  Best fried chicken of my life. End of story.   I cannot wait to go back here and order the entire restaurant!!!!!!!

9tz3zwHxqLN2aYO_Trdfng.text: I really enjoyed the thick breading on the chicken, in addition to the habanero hot sauce. The fries were also nice and crispy. I really enjoyed the food overall and the prices were reasonable for the portion size. Unfortunately, they do not have the $9.99 lunch special at this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0hmJKfTrft0sApG53dCZ_Q.text: Worth the high price for it.  I Ordered the wind man.  The service was good too. Came at. Fight during the week. Not too bad

Rd69USs_8KGkqkT0UszMfw.text: I've been craving this every day since I got back from Las Vegas. Super awesome. Very juicy. Well seasoned but not salty and that crunch.... OMG.

CjMY7mAst6KgsXveUfNhKg.text: If you love fried chicken and don't want to spend an arm and a leg on the strip, this place is fantastic. The chicken is SOOO good. Super crispy. Just the right amount of spice. My only caveat is, if you're not a huge fan of breading, I wouldn't recommend this. It's definitely not a "light coat".  They have a nice assortment of sauces for you to try, but honestly I think the chicken is fine on its own. They also have some cane sugar colas which are awesome but they don't give free refills which I personally think is kinda BS, but it is the strip so it is what it is.   You can't really eat anywhere "cheap" on the strip, but two people can get out of here for under $30 and definitely feel satiated, which is more than you can ask for a lot of other places. Plus, there's plenty of seating. If you can't find a spot inside or outside the restaurant, off to the side by Giordano's there's more.

_GnpCP7wxZnJ5HX6srUPhQ.text: The kale salad with fried chicken on top was phenomenal. (a) It's good to get in some greens and roughage while hanging out in this hedonistic land, and (b) the salad was fresh, flavorful, filling, and the fried chicken was bomb (crispy on the outside and tender /juicy on the inside). I would definitely go here again next time I'm hanging out on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kale salad with fried chicken - yum!

RHOqhdms_PAmgAXGu9cN_g.text: If you love fried chicken like me, but don't want to pay the Vegas price, Blue Ribbon is the place for you. It's located in this outdoor food court on the corner of Flamingo Rd and Las Vegas Blvd. They have quite a few options with their pieces of fried chicken, their famous chicken burgers, salads, and other things you can get ala carte. It is not a bad price for Vegas, and the food is tasty. I got their Blue Ribbon Sandwich, which is their most popular/original sandwich. The chicken was seasoned very nicely. You can taste the different spices. It was moist and super crunchy. I added a drink and fries for $2 more. It was SO worth!   My friends got pieces of fried chicken. I tried a bit of their's, and the chicken was the bomb! I wish I was able to go back to that place during my trip, but we didn't get the chance. Next time!   The service there was also on point! They were really friendly and seemed to be enjoying their time serving customers. Unlike most places where you order at the counter and they seem so unenthusiastic. That was a nice change. I'd definitely will come back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nDxbhVJEfVKoqKz7vK-O1w.text: Excellent Chicken that is extremely moist and very fresh tasting. The batter is on the medium side (not too heavy). They have many great sides at Blue Ribbon.  Everything is always fresh and they have great sides. They offer a nice variety of dipping sauces with a honey base.  The staff is really friendly and they have late hours daily. You will want to give Blue Ribbon a try. You will not be disappointed and you will be a regular.  Excellent!

OvIbGTXOuRZC4Txjhjy_hA.text: The chicken sandwiches here were just as good as it looked in the pictures! Not the best chicken sandwich I've ever had but better than a lot. We had the pit burger and the Kelly's burger. I liked the Kelly's burger a lot better just cause it was more sweet and flavorful than the other one. The wasabi honey with the chicken was pretty awesome. First time I've seen a place promote honey with fried chicken. It was definitely a wonderful combo. I'll most likely come back if I'm ever in Vegas craving a chicken sandwich at night!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A0LjVx2uuwQnKJ2UczSqxA.text: Love the food here!!   Located at the Bazaar in front of Starbucks, this cute chicken restaurant is a great place to stop in and get something quick and delicious to eat.   I came here last weekend and got the Cheesy Supreme chicken sandwich and the Fries with the works. They made it a combo, so it also came with a small coleslaw and I got a lemonade. The portions are much larger than I expected, so I wasn't able to finish everything and ended up sharing my fries.   The chicken sandwich came with 2 choices of cheese on the crispy chicken piece along with lettuce and tomato and their special sauce. Fries are made of cheddar, bacon and sour cream..can I say YUM!! Both the chicken sandwich and fries were delicious and I would definitely get them again.   Inside the restaurant, there are plenty of seating for you and a guest, but it's not big enough to have large groups of people. There are tables outside for those that have bigger groups of people eating here. Each of the inside tables has a collection of hot sauces and flavored honey as well as the hot sauce bar.   Employees here are very friendly and accommodating.

6OQGpfhBoGJPeub3miNNRA.text: I am here again for Hot Mary and I am trying Liver and Onion! The Liver and Onion soo good! Of Course Bloody Mary is ver good! And the chicken sandwich is soo good! The Sandwich of the Month is The Boo Bird for this month! It is $9.25 But it is so massive that, it didn't fit in my mouth! I had take one piece of Onion Rings out of it to fit my mouth~ It has one piece of Chicken with Pepper Jack Cheese, Onion Rings, Ghost Pepper BBQ sauce and Coleslaw! You can add Cole Slaw and their fries for $2.00! This sandwich is spicy and all so good! I think Coleslaw bring down the spice! And the fries were soo good too! The supervisor guy, thank you for your good service and your crew too! I will be back for that the Hot Mary!

WkJyGsgWtu4TIEg4NwNuZw.text: My bf loves fried chicken so we came here for dinner. We ordered the wing man and the natural chicken sandwich. Total came out to be around $19.   The wing man came with 2 pieces of wings with fries and cole slaw. The wings were alright but they were cold....And it didn't seem like it had much seasoning on it. The fries were shoestring fries which were actually pretty good. I'm not a big fan of cole slaw so I'm not sure if it was any good. The chicken sandwich was also cold. The salad filling inside the sandwich made the chicken soggy and cold. The taste overall was very bland. I was a bit disappointed since they seemed to be quite busy.   Overall, the chicken lacked taste and flavor. Our meal was cold and the meal was unsatisfying. They did have a station for sauces which included honey mustard, ketchup, bbq sauce, habanero, chipotle...etc. Most of their sauces were honey infused so they were on the sweeter side. Still does not beat Howlin Rays Chicken!

9v0gW-RPIEYCtfTrSp760g.text: Arguably one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I have ever had!!!  A fried chicken sandwich is my #1 choice at a restaurant. That being said, I read others reviews on here and knew I had to try.  I ordered "The Rancher" ($9) with a side of sweet potato fries. Comes with bacon and cheese which is wonderful. The sweet potato fries were delicious. They have lots of sauces, my favorite was their ranch dressing.  Overall very reasonably priced for the amount of food you get. 10/10 will return before my trip ends!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rancher w/ Sweet Potato Fries

kMLU44RAAaW8KudLbZFMfw.text: Randomly chose this place for lunch- walked over from Paris Las Brgas. The chicken was fast and hot and crispy and dusted with a delicious seasoning salt. They have bottles of Crystal hot sauce on the tables so i guessed we might be encouraged to use it and it made really good fried chickens even better.  The beer on tap was a bonus. Exactlyvthe lunch I needed and wanted.

Wjk0Dnl8n12XInJuozHWzg.text: There aren't a lot of semi-affordable options on the Strip that don't have wait times, so for that, Blue Ribbon serves a purpose. I love me some fried chicken, but I didn't think Blue Ribbon was spectacular by any stretch of the imagination.   The fries are good, and the chicken is solid (lots of pepper flavor!), but it's not lifechanging. The inside of the restaurant was pretty messy when we went (they're busy, I get it, but no one was cleaning up trays that looked like they had been sitting on tables for a while). The staff was also pretty unprofessional; any staff at a Shake Shack or In-n-Out would make this place look like McDonald's in terms of service.  If you've never been to a Blue Ribbon before, this is an "order at the counter place" that's pretty narrow inside and ultimately looks like a fast food restaurant (because it is). The chicken sits under lights, and they quickly grab it with tongs and give it to you. You can get food pretty fast as a result, but it's still hardly an upscale fast food place, which you'd expect after spending close to $20/person.   That being said, it serves a purpose. You can get food fast, and it has a lot of bready goodness. It's not fancy, but the fries are bomb, and the chicken is better than most fast food places. Is it worth going out of your way for? I'd say no, but if the craving hits and you just want something simple, it's worth a look.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White meat combo. Breast good. Wing is a pass.

DsbopGSlMoTpyUybY7PCiQ.text: It's alright. I paid $14 for two legs and a whole bunch of fries. Wasn't worth the money. It is fast so if you really hungry, it will be quick but you are going to pay.

sjrzb9g7LsPtQSfvF53c6w.text: The chicken was fascinating! It was very good, nice sized portions and the toppings complemented the chicken! It took a little bit of time for the food to come out but you appreciate that when it arrives hot! The drink choices were different. Not your typical Pepsi/Coke products!   The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.   It's definitely worth a stop if you're looking for something off the strip!!

epig-ggBzMo6txHH7J1wWg.text: 3 stars at best for the food, but the value brings it down to 2. Anyone who says otherwise has no taste palette.   They have a great location right in the Grand Bazaar, and we were really hopefully for some life changing chicken, but alas, we found it only to be average or below in almost every respect.   Pro's: -Chicken is actually prepared extremely well and very tender and fresh with a great texture and crunch -Fries were impressive, nice and crispy -Offer some unique shakes, we liked our salted caramel shake -Cool trash compactor instead of a usual bin  Cons: -Extraordinarily pricey, even by Las Vegas standards. $2.99 a drumstick, $4 for a thigh, and $5.50 for a single fried breast? $10 for a 2 piece dark meat meal? Excessive, especially for average size pieces of chicken  -Chicken is BLAND, despite being really well prepared. Hardly any flavor. No spice whatsoever, no perceivable paprika, cayenne, or white/black pepper. And it's like the chicken wasn't even seasoned under the breading. YOU NEED TO DOUSE IT IN SAUCE FOR ANY SEMBLANCE OF FLAVOR.  -Sauce bar sauces were only so-so. BBQ flavors were the best but didn't have incredible depth.. habanero sauce was more of a runny liquid but it was decent and had some kick.   -Paid $4 for the mac and cheese, which claimed to be smokey. It was GARBAGE. Worse than Kraft boxed mac! Not creamy, and the cheese was so bland. There's cheese present, you can see it but the lack of flavor left so much to be desired. It honestly tasted like boiled pasta! I suspected the worst when I was waiting for my food and noticed that at the table next to mine that had been vacated they left an almost untouched mac and cheese there among their trash... not a good sign. I was right.   My friend and I both came to the same conclusion. It's decent, not horrible, but the unimpressive bland flavors couple with the price factor IMO does not deserve the 4 stars they have at all. This place seems to just here to serve tourists who don't know any better or those who are easily impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks great! But the Mac is painfully tasteless and tastes like just boiled pasta. Chicken fares way better but still too bland.
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks great, but mac is painfully bland and tastes like boiled pasta. Chicken is way better but still lacking.

B4fo7wcjVr-vU2Y5z9df8Q.text: I absolutely loved the chicken.  The fries were ok.  The coleslaw was meh.  The big disaster was the BILL. Approximately $42 for 8 pieces, large boat of fries, and some drippy coleslaw.  WAY TOO EXPENSIVE for what it is.  I would come back to eat the chicken (only), but with so many other delicious options out there for half the price, most probably won't.

JdT2NBL_1msXcyZ5bDsKCA.text: The chicken is fried to perfection, fries are made perfectly, and the wait time wasn't long at all!! All of our food was freshly prepared and the lemonade was AMAZING so I am DEFINITELY gonna come back here when I visit Las Vegas again!!!!

mx_YnJRJiwFz5KPKVVc-Jw.text: Great fried chicken and cheap by Vegas standards!  Super crispy, super juicy.  Nicely seasoned as well.  I'm not a sauce-on-fried-chicken-guy but they had an assortment of BBQ sauces and honey.  Definitely worth a visit for a snack, especially when the post-imbibing munchies hit!

VS3d4R5iJwsQoTgtU1pnJQ.text: This ain't your Rosco's Chicken and Waffles.  Let's be real about fried chicken in any area dominated by tourists and shoppers- you're probably over paying for not-so-southern style fried chicken.  While Church's (aka Texas Chicken depending where you live) and Jollibee hold my top spots for taste and value, this place surpassed my expectations being smack in the middle of the LV strip.  For about $30, my girlfriend and i had a relatively generous dinner for what LV restaurants would offer at this price-point (3 thighs, a fried chicken sandwich, and sides).  There was no wait to order and plenty of seating, which was nice considering we went on a Saturday night.  Their sauce selection at the tables was nice- honey, some special sauce, a combo of hot sauce and honey, and a siriacha-like sauce.  And of course ketchup for non hipsters

mcSPMcgcEnctWpdhVbdqpw.text: I get the rancher because of my love for Ranch. The small fries is more than enough for me to share with the hubby.  What made my experience was the incredible service we got outside. Corey was so attentive but not a bother. He made sure to check in here and there. I see you Corey and your hard work. I just hope your boss sees this too! You are a rare sight to see in the customer service world. Thank you so much for taking such good care of us!

ZgJjpYpZ6QBXk7pf5WmzAQ.text: This is by far the best friend chicken I have ever had!  Friendly service and clean restaurant.  I was at the one in Downtown Summerlin, but pretty sure they will all be just as good!

lgMAs5DO1SnzpyrXbFRUyg.text: I've never had chicken that tasted quite like this! Would I ever get this chicken again if I'm in Vegas? No. But it's for a personal reason. I hate any type of spice/heat period! I have been drink for the last few hours and my boyfriend decided to stop here so I can absorb some of this alcohol. This place is located in the shopping area outside of Ballys hotel. The menu is a decent size and but the restaurant itself is small. The chicken is coated with a seasoning that has heat to it. This is what I didn't like. However, the strips I had were still good after I removed the skin. Also, the fries are great! They have many different sauces for your dipping pleasure. We didn't wait too long and the staff is nice.

te3_AmZukyiVxPN0_TqDFw.text: Looking for value for your money in Las Vegas can be a challenge. The gallery of shops and restaurants by Bally's are easy to miss if you are caught up in the crowd heading up and down the strip. Take a sidestep in from the sidewalk and head straight to the back. It's worth it!   We are in but noticed a brisk take out business with lots of locals. Always a good sign. Lots of tables inside and out.  Long family style seating and lots of seats at the bar.  They are licensed so cocktails, draft including some small brews and loaded shakes are all options.  The menu provides alot of options for number of pieces and white or dark meat.  Sandwiches are huge in fresh buns with loads of dressings.  Coleslaw is the non creamy variety, my favorite. Now the sauce, I believe there was 5 including a wasabi and straight up honey.  Service 5*.  These guys are in it. Fast organized and friendly.  Highly recommend and will be back.

xqfQzIplbKam7yPVLLNpZw.text: Amazing chicken! Definitely a go to for options on the strip that are reasonably price and delicious. Well worth the wait in line.

wRomX_0m1jeFx49OJXRq0g.text: Their fried chicken is not what I was expecting. I was disappointed. The skin is overcooked & dry. Chicken is too small and yet pricey than Brooklyn Bowl that serves Blue Ribbon Fried chicken too. Not a place I will come back to. I thought all Blue Ribbon Fried chicken are the same quality.

YppPX4i1M8feSvfCEX6KHQ.text: I actually went back to Vegas within 2 weeks of my initial review for a conference and stopped by this chicken place again. I think they read my review because they fixed the issues I had. The service was so much better. They got rid of some of the beers and added new ones. The chicken, fries and cole slaw were just as tasty. In fact the cole slaw was so good that I ordered another side of it.  I love this chicken place. I wish they had it in LA. I'm definitely going back when I go to Vegas. The prices are a bit steep but I guess it reflects the market price of the location.

ffQB_8Ma2NikZKLvFGQUyA.text: My husband and I came here on Sunday night and really enjoyed it! I got the Blue Ribbon sandwich and he got the Farmer's Sandwich (bacon and ranch). For $2 you can make the sandwich a combo -which comes with fries and coleslaw. The combo was a GOOD amount of food for the price! I liked the pickled cucumbers on the sandwich. However, I feel like the blue ribbon sandwich wasn't as great as the farmer's sandwich...it just tasted like it was missing something. Other than that, the food was great, service was good, and the price was on point!

_ypPCvZHuNXZjhEiQHNcHg.text: The chicken here is super tasty....the staff were kind and the food was delicious. I recommend the mac and cheese!

QnerINaBxnyRWECYA2dkLQ.text: The fried chicken is as advertised! It is so delicious also the drinks were great and the service was friendly and very quick. If I lived in Las Vegas I would eat here at least once a week.  everyone you must try it at least once!

OLFWz1Tn8fbjGrB_yfMsJg.text: Yummy fries and sandwiches! Wish we ordered more when we were in Vegas! Definitely coming back to this place when we visit again.

-9lJIph1pL9bh0UaXmy4xA.text: Really, really good fried chicken. This place must stay packed as there was a steady stream of people in line during our ordering and eating. CHsTB0yYFTD0oh-zzFdcdQ.text: My husband and I stopped by for a late night meal after watching a show. It was Sunday night after 11 pm and there were quite a few people here. We ordered the 4 whole wings meal which comes with the wings, a huge portion of fries, and a small side of coleslaw. The fried chicken was only ok. It's definitely better than fast food chains but not the best I've had. The skin was crispy but there wasn't much flavor. I also wish they gave a larger portion of coleslaw to balance out the oil from the chicken and the fries. The only downside to this place was there was literally no more sauces out on the table and their sauce station had a lot of empty bottles. Overall, it was a decent late night meal but I probably would choose something else next time.

TXku5URqlUT9_QCFzjGGsw.text: 5 stars for Service. 4 stars for the food! Saw this place on Instagram and had to have it. First off Instagram is all show some of the stuff that I saw they didn't have as people make their own or it was a monthly special.    Ordered a kids meal it comes with 1 chicken strip and I added one more. It was $3.25 for an additional strip I shouldn't haven't ordered another one because the portion is hugeee!  My kid couldn't even eat 1. :( We also ordered the family meal and 2 of their chicken sandwiches. Everyone seemed to enjoy the chicken. I ended up eating the chicken sandwich we ordered the blue ribbon original and the Firebird.  The original one was okay! I liked the Firebird better it was super spicy though but it was a good kick.  I wasn't too crazy for the pickled cucumbers. I love pickles but cucumbers on a chicken sandwich odd combo to me but some people love it. The fries were really good as well as the shakes.   Elvia the girl at the front as well as the others working there were amazing. But Elvia was a total sweetheart, patient and helped me on what to order. They have some good service here.  All in all it was good and glad I can cross this off my list of places to try.  Prices are a little high but overall a good spot to try.  They are very clean and constantly coming around wiping the tables and cleaning up.

d8CU7PE5cLMgyzPE8-k_vA.text: Fast & friendly service and delicious fried chicken! I got "The Firebird" sandwich with cheddar cheese and it was BANGING. The poblano peppers set. it. off. The mac n cheese was delicious, as were the shoestring fries. Loved their large selection of sauces + honeys! Will definitely visit again when I'm in town.

0JvcMSJRWI_gLdidF2Wq0g.text: Located in the back corner of the Bally's Grand Bazaar Shops (if you're entering from the Las Vegas Blvd. side), this chicken joint completely threw me for a loop.  I wasn't sure what to expect going in.  Since I've been on a bit of a bacon kick lately, I decided to try THE PIT (crispy fried chicken sandwich with aged cheddar, smoked bacon and BBQ sauce)... Whoa!  I was blown away by the juiciness of the chicken breast.  The hearty bun was toasted slightly but still soft.  The cheese, the BBQ sauce, the Chipotle honey... the service, the wait time... it was all spot-on.  That $9.75 delectable monster barely fit in my hands but I managed!  The stringy fries were fresh, as was the coleslaw.  Beverage-wise, that Boylan's Diet Cane Cola was leagues better than any diet soda I typically drink.    When it was all over, I actually enjoyed watching the futuristic-looking trash compactor do its thing... ha!   This was the last meal before my return flight home, so I was definitely glad to cap off my Vegas trip on such a high note.                   I'm honestly racking my brain to try and think one thing I did not like... but I've come up empty-handed.  Even at $17 for everything I had, it's still significantly cheaper than most restaurants on the strip.  Bravo, BRFC!!  So... when are you coming to Orlando?

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pit with fries, slaw and diet cane cola.

1WrZ0g3tPFP9DTDhNMdU1g.text: Solid fried chicken. Solid sauces. Solid experience. It was good but nothing impressed. Enjoy!

PYtjwJDXRDkke9UpTqndfw.text: So I rarely order fried chicken because most restaurants dont get it right but this place came highly recommended so I gave it a try... They are appropriately named Blue Ribbon because this is some award winning tasty chicken. I also ordered the loaded fries... while aesthetically pleasing, they did nothing for the taste buds. Fortunately those wings were so good I wasnt too upset about the potatoes missing the mark.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy 4 wing combo
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded fries are okay but get those wings!!

wcM15lVJqBp4spu5oswJdw.text: When I found out that there was a Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken spot in Vegas, I knew I had to eat there during my trip. I used to eat at their NYC location pretty often when I lived there and I really do believe it's the best fried chicken spot in NYC. The Vegas location didn't disappoint. It was just as juicy and tender as I remembered.

PUkYcbUUujx19KN2BufE8w.text: I love the chicken wings here!  We went on Monday night, it wasn't busy at all. I ordered the Blue Ribbon sandwich and a wing (just to try). The sandwich was good, had a lot of flavor. The chicken wing was great, I loved it. It was crispy and seasoned very well. Next time I go here I think I will do a wing combo vs. a sandwich, both were good, I just prefer the wings over the sandwich, They had a few different house made (I think) hot sauces to try. The fries were okay.   This location in particular is small, but they have outdoor seating if you can't find a spot inside. The staff were very friendly, they greeted us as soon as we walked in the door. The food is made to order, so there's a little wait, but it wasn't too long, Maybe 10 min. I guess for Vegas the prices aren't too bad, especially being on the Strip.  I would love to here again someday!

1YRzLJkC1MbuxCE3NI4Twg.text: I don't give a lot of 5-star reviews but every bite was better than the last at BRFC. Unreal delicious. I love fried chicken/chicken tenders etc, and these are the best of the best. Super juicy, amazing flavor. They look spicy/hot but they're not; they're just perfectly seasoned. You won't get a crunch like a battered tender, but instead it's almost like a crispy skin. The fries are good, but if you have to choose one side, opt for the smoked macaroni and cheese. I have no idea what kind of cheese they use, but it'll be my life mission to replicate this. O. M. G. 10/10 would order again. My husband got The Rancher and raved about it. Add this to your must-visit list in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7BcU1hrE-p4d8z6byE11_g.text: BEST DAMN CHICKEN I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE!    What else is there to say?  It was hot out the grease, fresh, and full of favor.. What I also liked was the different sauces that you dip you chicken in... I would of gave it 5stars but the fries where cold! Good but warm enough.  Service was AWESOME!! My mouth is watering just thinking about this chicken!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two piece dark with fires.

2FKNtxRy17M1ZbLQuCrTTQ.text: Perfect place to grab a quick late night snackie. The fried chicken was crispy, juicy, and tender. I liked how there was a variety of sauces to choose from for dipping the chicken in. My favorite sauces were the honey-based ones, especially the wasabi honey and the chipotle honey. The sweetness provided a nice contrast to the savory flavor of the chicken.  The fries were also a nice surprise I was not expecting. They were cut thinly and tasted super crunchy. Blue Ribbon probably ranks as one of my top spots for fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings and fries combo

2LcWf1sfLnNTAZbLJ9bGNA.text: I have not been back to Las Vegas since 2013 and a lot has changed since then!  My friend told me about this chicken place, so I had to try it.  Their chicken was very meaty, crispy, and tasteful.  The seasoning they have on the chicken taste great and you didn't have to dip the chicken in any sauce.  On the tables, they have a variety of different sauces.  I really like the Honey Wasabi it's more sweet than spicy and I don't even like wasabi.    Inside is small seating area but there are tables outside to enjoy people watching.  The staff is friendly and they clean the tables after each person finishes.

8uYF9qWia9ZR1KhSIGTV1A.text: Winner-Winner Chicken Dinner (actually it was lunch) but never the less, this may have been the best fried chicken I've eaten and that includes my wife's which is excellent.  Of course I found this place "Yelping" and it lived up to the reviews.  Small eat in take out fast food type place but that's where the comparison stop. Friendly hello upon opening the door and the aroma of fried urns, spices and chicken tips the scales.  Several options of He icee of chicken you desire and nice sides to accompany them I went with a breast and two wings that came along with shoestring fries that were plentiful and a side of coleslaw that was delicious. Chicken was juicy inside and super crispy and  super favorable on the outside. If you are in the area this is a must try. Just good fried chicken.

qiKwX_AidLxd6GEZoeTUsA.text: I'm glad they put a location on the strip! I had their other location bookmarked for a while and never had the chance to try it. This one is in the Grand Bazaar shops by Bally's casino. I stopped by 10 minutes before they closed and the employees were still very friendly even though they probably wanted to go home lol. I ordered The Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich and it comes with the special sauce, lettuce, tomato, pickled cucumbers. The wait wasn't long at all and I appreciated that they made the food fresh. There's also a variety of sauces at the condiment station... which is great if you're like me and like to dip each bite into something different.   There is seating inside and tables outside as well. The hours here are 11am-2am. The food was really good! Next time I come I'll wear sweatpants to try more of the menu.

k8yjrwKnWJdMuy0xIy5lMw.text: While fried chicken may not be my favorite food on earth, this place definitely offers the best drumsticks I've ever had.  They are crispy and juicy at the same time. I also loved their seasoning. My friend also loved their chicken sandwich. Friendly workers too! We went there during early lunch time, and we got served pretty fast. I will definitely recommend if you like fried chicken.

Hv3Es2zT4sSSC1hLcojLbw.text: I had high hopes for this because of the other reviews and pictures of the food, but this had to be the most bland/flavorless food I've had in a long time.  The chicken had no flavor at all, the Mac and cheese tasted like plain noodles, the BBQ chicken tasted like sloppy joe sauce/ketchup.  Maybe it was an off night, but it's disappointing to throw away 30 dollars of food due to it having no flavor/seasoning whatsoever.

Qr21PtikStGEVB5dV_HCVw.text: Damn good fried chicken. One of my friends made it a point to stop by this place during our most recent trip to Vegas and it was the perfect midday meal before transitioning into nightlife mode.   Everything was delicious, so it doesn't matter if you went with the chicken tenders, the wings, or a chicken sandwich. Pieces were seasoned well and  breaded perfectly with just enough crunch on the outside, but soft and tender on the inside.   It was early February at the time and it was hot as hell inside. I don't know if the ac wasn't working but if the temperature is like that all year round, you might want to eat outside or get your food to go.

BYQhFSJCv3YYzNiKY3d1tg.text: What an amazing chicken sandwich but I think it's pretty pricey.  I'm the biggest fan of fried chicken and this place was definitely on par. I came here on a Vegas trip and I definitely do not regret it. I highly recommend this place.   we all know chick fila is pretty bomb but imagine that x10!!! it's that good!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicey chicken!  Bomb af!

jZWcVM39dnJG_Qrovp1gYg.text: More like a 3.5. It's not the best fried chicken sandwich I had but I like the variation for it. The chili one that I had was actually pretty damn spicy so it kinda gives a twist to your regular fried chicken sandwich. The other reasons why I like it though is that they have a good variety of sauces(honey, chipotle honey, wasabi honey and so on). I also really love the fries. These kind of fries are my absolute favorite. The thinner the fries, the more I like it. I had a bite of the fried chicken itself because my friend ordered it and that was the most surprise of all because the chicken itself was actually very good. However, I'm still unsure if I'll get the chicken itself over the sandwich just because I feel it's more worth it for the sandwich in terms of being full and a good portion vs the chicken itself.  I personally liked Blue Ribbon...It isn't Howling Rays but I would definitely come back AND it's probably one of the cheaper meals you can get in vegas.

I waited 17 minutes for a 2 piece dark with sweet potato fries and a chicken sandwich that was cold and soggy, also when I went up to the counter to ask about my order I over hear a conversation between a woman who looked like she may have been a manger or supervisor and a cook about prostitution , using profanity. cCUApJoMPCcilSDW4OjF5Q.text: As i wandered the slightly maze like Grand Bazaar shops at Ballys in early afternoon trying to decide what to eat, Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken caught my eye, the look of the place is cool and casual. Great music playing too! While the chicken sandwiches looked fantastic on the menu, I kept it real simple and just ordered a (bone in) Chicken Breast (visible behind the counter), and it was fantastic! Chicken was tender and spices were great, a nice crunch and not too greasy. Nice selection of drinks and there is a water station inside which is a nice touch. It was a satisfying and quality quick lunch!

Crq84yS70nXJRle2WeWAPw.text: Indeed the best fried chicken I've ever had in US, period. The only problem is that it is tooooo crowded! And the service speed suffers from that.

2k3QrKBDqmujtiXghvwWtw.text: The food here is amazing. Probably the best fried chicken in the city! Staff is friendly and the location is clean! Very family friendly and the restraint is casual. Employees are helpful and all of there food is quality.

zkyRVMXDxdsjrauvTKBkdA.text: I just won $400 at the casino and i feel like i still lost after eating this half ass chicken. Wtf have you people been eating? I got a basic ass chicken sandwich with a half fresh roll and basic chicken patty. I got the Firebird sandwich. On a bed of lettuce, might as well call it the firebird salad. The chicken is not crispy at all and has no flavor. The chipotle mayo is good but anyone that messes up chipotle mayo should not be in the food business. I bet you can walk next door to wahlburgers and get a better sandwich. Or get pizza at the giordano place next door. This is awful. And their service is nothing special. Forgot my beer and i had to ask her for it and then she started checking past receipts like i was lying. Foh. You guys can enjoy the product of good marketing while i go eat good food.

FZO5hSjRHJmBftaFjh0biw.text: There was a short line when we came in. Asked Marzella at the bar/counter if we needed to order at register before we sat down. She said she could help us. We just wanted a snack to share with three people so we could make it until dinner. She helped us decide what to order and then gave my boyfriend samples of multiple drinks to choose from. The chicken is delicious and the fries are great. My boyfriend doesn't even like fried chicken and he went crazy over it. It's a must do if you are in the area.

87FSbWqqwf1SooCqTYQ6KQ.text: The firebird was the perfect kick! The spiciness was just enough to keep you holding on to a cup of water with the other hand. Nice quick meal on the strip overall.

T3BDghuABryhk6Gy1luNAw.text: I work at Wahlburgers right next door so I come here a lot during my lunch break. While I haven't tried a lot on the menu yet I can easily say this is the best fried chicken I've ever had. I've never loved fried chicken, but I find myself craving this place. It's pricey for sure but it's also on the strip. I like that they let me have extra fries instead of the coleslaw. They also have some good dipping sauces. Their homemade ranch is really good and their chipotle honey is so delicious. I'm so glad this place opened up next to my job.

WANAVFe4mgZ7PHYQ4Ukheg.text: We tried this place for the first time today while we were on vacation in Las Vegas. This place is absolutely delicious if you're looking for an over the top chicken place. We had the sandwiches, mine was a special with chopped bacon, BBQ sauce, cheddar, and macaroni and cheese.. My bf had the one with bacon and ranch. We also got the loaded fries with chopped bacon, sour cream, and cheese.. It was all delicious but it is also a billion calories..

-pf1qUqhl_q7UVXiWD1vyg.text: Best fried chicken sandwich I had , went back following day for a repeat. The sauce in the sandwich is incredible and the chicken is perfect! Will definitely be back next time Iam in Las Vegas.

S7pK2rJJWBd6eWWeKLnOqQ.text: We wanted fried chicken while we were on our anniversary trip and this place didn't disappoint. The drinks are great! cMbQbrvx6NlAonk2aiWbfg.text: Came to Vegas over the weekend for my best friends birthday with all of my close friends. We were looking for a place to eat that was close to our hotel and not too pricey. We stumbled across this place. The interior was simple and it was easy to order. One of the men working was very helpful and suggested I try the Blue Ribbon Sauce. My chicken was cooked perfectly, fries were generously portioned, but the sauce definitely gave it that perfect kick. I also tried the Mac n cheese which was VERY cheesy. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely hit this place up again.

BpeE_3uNTK9lo9bhm6oveA.text: Strolling the strip a few weeks ago and it was hot. Real hot. I needed some comfort food as the night before was a good but long one. So fried chicken was on my menu. I usually hit up Popeyes, but I'm in Vegas, i can have Popeyes anywhere. And lets be honest, that can always be hit or miss depending on which one you go to. Blue Ribbon was amazing! Great quality big pieces of chicken and fried to perfection! Im a thigh man so i devoured two pieces & some bomb mac n cheese. I struck up a conversation with the store manager to get some info about their history and he couldn't have been more friendly and insightful. Gave me their history and even showed me how to properly mix the various honeys & hot sauces to get the maximum signature flavor. Next time im on the strip im definitely going back! They even have a walk up bar so you can walk the strip with a PBR and a drumstick in your hand lol

KbWJ-zFxnfSQCYryZNhqSQ.text: I did not care for the food. I know it is Vegas so it will be pricey but for the food we got I do not think it was worth it. I have had better chicken and the mac n cheese was not good at all.
