QuLykyR0MTpaYBYGIIGyqw.text: Best chicken fingers I've ever had. Customer service can be hit and miss sometimes. Sometimes they're super nice and inviting other times it seems as if they don't care but over all real good chicken!

EecbeKjKra-Pd9-rFU3t5A.text: DELICIOUS chicken sandwiches. SO good. My husband got the special they had on Cinco de Mayo. It was good but almost too much to enjoy because it fell apart and was messy. But it still tasted good. I had one with ranch on it, can't remember which one. It was yummy.

DCnB-u4GTYrK0vW2VWoRGQ.text: Long wait for dry chicken, thin greasy fries. Refused refills on soda which made it impossible to finish the dry chicken.  Took most of it in a to go box, but never brought myself to finish it so now it is in the trash.  Very expensive for what it is.

-jSi1tcHvWf3LDcZNthTWg.text: Hell Yeah.  Moist, crispy chicken.  Great fries, thick shakes.  This is the ultimate in late night comfort food

VzXOs0k_kjvAuj9s0Fqj4g.text: Blue Ribbon is a bona fide restaurant empire, spanning the continent from South Beach to Los Angeles. It's grown from a late night chef's hangout to a dominant brand in high quality sushi, oysters and grilled meats. Their sushi has always been slightly above my price point, so I jumped at the chance to taste their touted fried chicken in a casual Vegas takeout spot.  Sadly, it was not life changing. For about $10, you get an enormous fried chicken breast sandwiched in a woefully inadequate bun. While the Cheesy Supreme and Firebird look gorgeous on Instagram, they're challenging and somewhat tedious sandwiches to eat. This is primarily due to a lack of seasoning. Yes, Blue Ribbon chicken is surprisingly bland, with most of its flavor provided by sauces and condiments.  The chicken itself is well-prepared, but the skin is dry and crunchy. Due to it's thickness, little flavor penetrates into the dense interior of the chicken beast, leaving you with bite after bite of tasteless matter. You can pump as much ranch or chipotle mayo as you like onto the carcass, but it doesn't quite compensate for what ultimately amounts to a mediocre recipe.

YCrojLeYJtqfaUCXAR_idA.text: I visited Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken right after they initially opened in Las Vegas.  The chicken was moist and delicious, and they had a variety of sandwiches.  They even offered fried chicken backs, gizzards and livers.  You could not get any more Southern than that!  This place was "da bomb" and I could not wait to visit again!  Fast forward, May 2019, HOW CAN A RESTAURANT DEVOLVE SO QUICKLY!!!  The menu was completely different.  They no longer offer the variety of sandwiches, there were no fried livers and gizzards and they even took the sweet potato fries off the menu... this is a travesty of justice!    When I noticed this drastic change, I should have turned around and walked out.  However, I gave them the benefit of the doubt. The young man at the counter was the same one who was there at the opening.  When I asked what happened, the only excuse I was offered is the supplier changed.  Aaaah, hello, the supplier of what.... the supplier of chicken, the supplier of flour...what part changed, the supplier of cooks in the kitchen!?!?  It did not make sense because the supplier should not affect the quality and taste of the chicken.  Now, after we ordered the food, it was nothing short of sad.  The french fries and tater tots were super greasy, the macaroni and cheese was on the dry side and the chicken was overcooked,  the chicken tenders were beyond dry....they murdered them and they did not offer the variety of barbecue sauces they had when they first opened.  I have to say, there is nothing worse than getting full on nasty food.  I was so embarrassed after bragging about how good this place was to my family.  The crazy part is my niece said we could have gotten better food at Popeyes, at least they always deliver!  I could only hang my head in shame.  Unless something changes, I will not be going back to this restaurant unless there is a miraculous improvement.

OGBOoJ-hDg8cMOYCEAP0qw.text: The boneless chicken tenders were good. The service is a little slow do to its popular demand. I will have to try the other stuff on the menu. I would take the food to go.

The chicken is fresh out of the fryer, is amazing crispy, and seasoned with an unknown concoction that makes it perfection. They have all these different type of bbq sauces that are so delicious you could drink em. ALSO THEY HAVE WET WIPES. How nice is that?! Oh and the fries are amazing and the drinks are super strong and only like 10$

The chicken was tender and juicy and crunchy at the same time, just like grandma used to make it. The sauce bar was a nice touch with BBQ honey and wasabi honey to name a few of my favorites. vzrfmbgSMO4qTxLjt-4tBw.text: Blue Ribbon Chicken is in the Grand Bazaar Shops by the Bally's escalator and across from Starbuck's. It is a restaurant that would be at home down the Boulevard in New York-New York considering that it started in SoHo New York City around 25 years ago.    This marked my second Blue Ribbon Chicken experience. My first time in one was in April 2016 when I dined in the Downtown Summerlin location. The Grand Bazaar location had been so close yet so far away. Physically I had been in its shadow several times when I hung out across from it in the Starbuck's patio. Mentally it wasn't in my radar for the restaurants that I wanted to dine at. That was until late November 2018. In the beginning of the Holidays Season when the Las Vegas Strip transformed into a Winter Wonderland, I did one of my Seasonal hikes there. Planning to take a break for a fast food dinner, I made an executive decision to give this restaurant a try.    In hindsight this is one of those restaurants where the delicious aroma tasted better than the food. If I was clueless where in the Grand Bazaar Shops it was, my olfactory scent would of led the way.   Before setting foot in the restaurant, an outside window menu made ordering easy. I like it when restaurants have menus away from the counter. I don't feel as if I am holding up a line or making myself uncomfortable with an employee anxious for me to make up my mind. However, the menu excluded the prices of drinks. Could it be that a medium fountain beverage costs $3.25? Inside the overhead menu showed additional items including beverages. Being on the Las Vegas Strip, restaurants have to have adult beverages. Right? To the left of the outside window mirror there is a window where customers can order adult beverages.    My mind was set on the two piece breast and thigh white chicken meal with shoestring fries, and cole slaw. It costs $11.95. The medium soda as I stated earlier was $3.25. The total came out to $16 and change. According to the Blue Ribbon literature the restaurants founding Brothers created this special recipe where they prepare the chicken in egg whites coated with matzo meal and fried. According to me, the chicken was sitting on top of a kitchen warmer with several others. My picture of the kitchen below shows this. This is not a bad thing. This restaurant does reach a high busy level where the staff have to take precaution to avoid long waits. When it came to waiting for my food, faster than I wrote this sentence it was ready. I paid and before reaching my chair, they called my order. In contrast, when I dined in the Downtown Summerlin location that has since closed, they provided me with a beeper that went off a few minutes later when that food cooked from the time of order was ready.    The plate included a superfluous of shoestring fries. They were solid yet nothing spectacular. The chicken was decent. Just as I remembered the late Downtown Summerlin location, the skin was far better than the meat. I feel that they could of served a larger breast and thigh. The thigh was more skin than meat. At least during my visit. This brings me to saying that at a $16 and change price point, the customer ought to be able to order two chicken breasts that has superior meat than the chicken breast and thigh. The cole slaw that I saved for last was solid. In the beverage department, Blue Ribbon provides uniqueness in serving Boylan fountain beverages. They are known for using cane sugar in place of high fructose corn syrup. I dig Boylan Cream Soda.    Blue Ribbon is an upbeat restaurant to dine in. The same positive energy that fills the Las Vegas Strip covered the eatery. It is a long eatery in an outdoor mall that reminds me of the Downtown Container Park. In spite of this, I felt like I was dining in a very bright railroad dining car. This is a long and narrow eatery. It was at the long counter that I sat. I preferred this to the long table nearby with strangers. Not far from my seat was the sauce bar. If I had chosen to I could of spruced up the chicken with one of the five sauces seen in the sauce bar photo below.     Based on my experience, Blue Ribbon is obviously a fast food restaurant serving a decent chicken meal that in my opinion is not worth $16 and change with a beverage. Even for the Las Vegas Strip. Who knows if I'll return.

FH-HGHNWNdHaKnjnAPo6zw.text: This place is crusty. It's in a little strip mall. They have a Instagram page that is completely misleading. Most of everything on that page is for their New York location only.  The place is not very clean. The worker were not very friendly. The smoked Mac and cheese was ok. It's so disappointing it looks so good on Instagram. And the ranch was bad. Maybe I came on a off day. But I won't take another chance I won't be back. The 2 is for the one friendly worker and the decent Mac and cheese. They have no chicken sandwiches or buffalo wings here the pics on these reviews are pretty misleading

8rs527-Sq_A_xxgpM-X2lQ.text: Had a burger with extra chicken and a single wing al carte.  The extra chicken on the sandwich is just another patty. Though it admittedly is quite a bit of food. Wouldn't really say the sandwich was so good that it was worth the 13-14 dollars.  I wasn't impressed by this small fried chicken chain despite being very hungry. The food was fine but nothing was particularly outstanding.   The breading they use is on the bready side and tastes like many other fast food chains. This is especially noticeable with the patty which isn't a piece of chicken breast but more processed like a culet, or again like something you'd get at a chain. The chicken wing I got was fine but it just wasn't high quality.  Was also turned off by the cashier who was rude. I normally don't write about service but this was pretty egregious especially given it was in Vegas.  You can add other sauces at the table though I did not since I wanted to try their food as is.   Personally I would skip the meal here at blue ribbon fried chicken given all the other amazing food choices here in Vegas. It definitely does not compare to great fried chicken places in LA like Howlin' Ray's or Dave's Hot Chicken.

kRfmfjPFIGWaruJdsmMPDA.text: I probably should've tried some of the sides here cause they looked quite tasty.  Pros? Chicken was moist and well seasoned Friendly staff Enjoyed the spice level of the chicken sandwich Sweet potato fries on point   Cons? Only huge portions I've had better fried chicken

86cRZHc3hCZ4xAQo7F8OtA.text: I wanted to try this based on a recommendation from All You Can Vegas on YouTube. I paid $22 for a thigh and drumstick combo with fries and coleslaw plus a side of Mac and cheese. The reviews were accurate. Food came out hot but very bland. The honey didn't do anything to the chicken. We saw folks throwing out leftover chicken so I'm pretty sure it wasn't just us.

oaDmdlYjGA8TD6x2k2NRsw.text: I used to come to this place often, they had the best sandwiches I've ever had. Their bone-in products are ok, but there was no notice that their sandwich items in Vegas were no longer going to be served. When I went in, it was like a ghost town, instead of the usual packed to the brim place. When I asked the cashier where the sandwiches were or went, "I don't know." Is all I got and everyone seemed unhappy.   When yall bring the sandwiches back I'll be there.

gTBYC_7ChKNGAIh_7W8LRw.text: Chicken Type: Southern Fried Chicken Business Type: National Chain (3 locations) Beverages: Bottled beers on tap, Milkshakes, Soft Drinks, Iced Tea/Sweet Tea and Lemonade (spiked available).  Overall opinion: The chicken was on the dry side, but seasoned well enough.  I liked the Breast more than the strips, but overall both were average.  Biscuit was very average as well.

jkEf83W4vYGTW76NUu1wnQ.text: I was told that this was one of the highly reviewed fried chicken places in Las Vegas, so I decided to try it out. I ate a drumstick and was not that impressed. Coming from Alabama where I have access to a bunch of fried chicken, I didn't think that the chicken I had was that great. The chicken was moist; however, the seasoning on the outside of the chicken almost gave it a slight bitter taste. Maybe I'm used to a different type of seasoning, but eating chicken here wasn't as life-changing as I was hoping it would be.   I will say, however, that management is very generous. The cashier accidentally rung me up for an extra piece of chicken which caused some confusion. She quickly fixed it, and I waited for my order. When I went to go pick it up, I noticed that they gave me two free pieces. So, even though the chicken is just decent, I can tell that management is very customer satisfaction-oriented, which means that you will have a nice dining experience either way.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Three drumsticks and a thigh

fhD3C3mHokt8gZAoAqEk4w.text: Best chicken ever!!!  Was pressed for time And they were fast!! A wide variety of honeys! Chicken was crispy and soft and delicious!

5SP9FDCnxdrcBzIcLb5kRQ.text: Blue Ribbon Sandwich: 3/5 Tastes better with the wildflower honey provided at the sauce bar.   Drumstick: 4/5 I would've liked the drumstick more if it was crispier.   Fries: 5/5 I love how crispy and tiny the fries are!  Lemonade: 3.5/5 A little too sweet but really refreshing! A 12oz would've been better

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o0qNnqRj5z47dH7iL9oWRQ.text: Unbelievably delicious! Walking in I thought the prices were high but it was worth every penny. The chicken was perfectly cooked and all of the sauce combinations were perfection! You can not go wrong eating at this place. I am speechless. This place is amazing!!

POygm8Q5UZTODMFSMPt0_Q.text: Saw this place when we ate nearby the day prior. We were with a group of 7, which included two children.  If you have not been here prior then you have a range of selection from sandwiches to pieces of chicken and different sides. For us, it was difficult to measure which meal would be appropriate for us. We opted for chicken sandwiches and two piece meals for the younger kids to share. We also ordered a Nutella milkshake, mac and cheese, as well as spicy coleslaw. The milkshake was phenomenal.  The fries that come with the meals are thin and actually really good, you do have the option to do the works, which brings cheese/sour cream/bacon, but it seemed like too much. The chicken is great and the wasabi honey was delicious! As for the mac and cheese and coleslaw/spicy coleslaw, you won't be disappointed. The Mac and cheese is really cheesy and a good proportion with the small size.  Overall, it is not too excessively overpriced, but it is $10-$15 per person depending on if you order a drink. The soft drinks are craft, which means it is slightly different than the regular syrup.  We will most definitely be returning here, but be mindful that seating can be limited considering it is not a huge restaurant, but we were lucky to find seating for 7. There is a take out option, which seems pretty convenient, which we will probably use in the near future!

A24hjzdL_oxadijagp7OHQ.text: Okay I'm not sure if I was really hungry after my stroll down on the Vegas strip or what, but their fried chicken was so good!! Hey, we all know what fried chicken tastes like and will know a great one from a mediocre ones!!  They know how to produce good fried chicken that is moist, seasoned well, & fried well. All the sauces were awesome - my fav was the chipotle honey sauce! The lady who is in the front (young black lady) was so friendly! She was such a doll.  If you are looking for a lunch spot walking down the strip, make sure you check this place out! They truly deserve the blue ribbon for their fried chicken~

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dark meat

ZfePMn1i2PxO2MLbe0Zvjw.text: DAY:  - Saturday for lunch.  LOCATION/INTERIOR:  - located in the shopping area right outside of Bally's.  - they have seating inside and outside.  ORDER & TASTE: * You order first then they will give you a buzzer for when your order is ready.  When you pay with card, there is a prompt to tip - I don't appreciate this system especially because of the service I received. I don't think they served the tip.  The girl taking the order was not friendly.   - 2 pc tenders ($9.95): this is the combo that comes with fries and coleslaw. Chicken itself was okay, wasn't dry so that was at least good. But presentation was terrible. If you like the thin strongly fries, it is pretty good. It was crispy. Still think it was expensive for the 2pc.  - fries the works small ($7.75): I honestly didn't think this was with it at all. It didn't like very appetizing and it was super oily.  Don't waste your money.  * For the price, didn't think the food was worth it.  CUSTOMER SERVICE:  - was disorganized and did not seem like they had a system at all.  - waited forever for our food. Which is stupid since they already have stuff ready.   - once we got it, it wasn't event correct. Had to go back inside to get the missing item from our order.

mPIP8XEMg4g3I4wWUWA53w.text: Not too bad honestly. I kept thinking this place looked like a knock off Popeyes, but the chicken is decent for what you're paying (Vegas prices).   Ordered the 4 piece meal, which is a breast, whole wing, drumstick, and thigh. Price comes in at $17.95, cheaper than if you got the dark meal and the white meat meal as separate orders.  Meal comes with fries and coleslaw. Added a side of smoked mac n cheese (extra) bringing my order to around $23. I mean, more than I'd pay for chicken at home, but not the most expensive meal I've eaten on the strip by far.   Heavy on the seasoning, but the breast was really large and juice and so was the wing. I was also pleasantly surprised to find the fries were really really good. I'm not a coleslaw person so I skipped the slaw. Overall, good food with an okay price.

MFT83NYOo5bDG48eszyW-g.text: Just stopped in for a 1:30am late night, sweet-tooth craving and got their Hazelberry spiked shake and it definitely did the job. Well blended with an almost PB-J like flavor. I slurped it down in no time at all. It's a little pricey, but that's Vegas, so get over it.

hiKEG8MniArf_KUZ8AEroQ.text: I have to start this review by saying that I didn't eat at Blue Ribbon. We only stopped by to get my husband a Bloody Mary. But what a drink that was! A sip of it was enough for me to give them 4 stars.  Why? Because there's a chicken wing in the drink! That's something I'd never seen before. And, on top of that, the drink tasted delicious!   Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll definitely stop by for a drink and some food, too. In fact, I'm very much looking forward to that!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Bloody Mary with a chicken wing...only in Vegas!

XIs2GJbBWF7TFyev19X_nA.text: Mmmm delicious fried chicken and fries!! My friends and I landed in Vegas at around 9:30pm and were starving and wanted some quick, cheap, but good eats for the night. We stopped by this place and were all very satisfied. I got the chicken sandwich, and it was very flavorful. The chicken was well-seasoned and crispy. The sauces were also really good - I enjoyed the wasabi honey and chipotle honey. My friends got the chicken only (drums, wings, thighs), and also really enjoyed their meal. We all loved the thin, crispy fries! Overall, a great, affordable choice for a quick meal!

lyeISEkxWf1m2dP_T3sucg.text: I always wanted to try Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken when I was in NY but never got a chance.  I recently went on a trip to vegas and saw that they opened one in LV! I got the chicken sandwich and it was delicious!  The sauce and chicken went together perfectly!  I really love the sauce and the fresh and juicy lettuce! Great place! Love their chicken sandwiches!

3ul41jVotbS0F1KcIr0eRw.text: Not sure about the hype. I ordered the freebird. I like trying sig sandwiches. Took almost a minute for the cashier to acknowledge me, and i was the only one in line. The sandwich was ok. Nothing special. A little expensive but what isnt on the strip. I'd rather have chic fil a. It just lacked a wow flavor.  The fries were same. Just regular. Some of these places on the strip, like hattie b's, do such a fine job branding that they really have people thinking they are eating the best chicken ever. I respect their marketing team, but the food doesnt match the hype at all.

OFQrGUiACq90sb9uQxa8tA.text: It may just seem like fried chicken but it was (kind of sadly) my favorite meal in Vegas. We ordered two chicken combos, which both came with fries and coleslaw and a blue ribbon chicken sandwich. The cashier was friendly and understanding of our indecisiveness as well as our little paying war (Asians always want to pay). But the fried chicken was perfect. Good amount of spice and juicy. I normally don't eat that much coleslaw but i ate almost half. And I couldn't stop eating the fries. The hot sauce available isn't that hot but that was a minor detail. And the staff brought us water without asking, even though it was self-serve. The only thing I didn't like was how loud the music was--we had to shout to hear ourselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Stb0IGHbURI7H_o6B8AI5Q.text: Blue Ribbon Fried chicken for the 1st time tonight after work at the Bazaar shops in front of Bally's. This is one monster frickin' chicken! So come with an appetite, delicious to boot. I had the Cheesy supreme with aged cheddar & American cheeses. Also big shout out to the sauce wheel at the table. With BBQ, hot sauce, wasabi honey, wildflower honey & Chipotle honey! I tried them all & they are all so creative and good as was the blue ribbon special sauce that come on the burger. You know I gotta have my special sauce!!! The staff was friendly & the wait was short for how packed it was.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheesy Supreme

i1EuL6HxmXYr4s3LnuPoYg.text: The food is delicious and the service is good. The people who are working here have a positive attitude and they are nice when they take your order and serve your food. I recommend this place for anyone who is in the area. Try it out.

P4f2Y4cA8OcmWlibsT-oyg.text: I've had this spot bookmarked for a while now. The strip crowds and other madness has kept me away... HOWEVER I had my mind made up that tonight was the night. We made the drive and traveled through the redefined concrete jungle known as the strip. Once we rounded the corner I could see the signs shinning bright and from a bustling business. We could see that it was clearly busy because the building is basically a giant class LEGO piece( DECOR: modern, bright, gameshow meets New York City).   We made our way towards the register and we were greeted by about 4 employees anxiously awaiting to assist us. I ordered ITEM after ITEM after ITEM. The chances of me making this trip again are about slim to none anytime soon... SOOOO why not gorge out on premium chicken and such.   Tenders, wings, sandwiches and old school cola drinks. Instant happiness!   In the end my ultimate suggestion... PURCHASE A BEAK TO BUTT to go on your way out. If you plan on drinking and hangin that is perfect A.M. Hangover food thank me later .

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t forget to kick it up
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Works sweet potato fries and Rancher sammmmich

SJW2onmdhAJk-dkvN8V2Rw.text: Best fried chicken in Vegas! We had an excellent experience when we came in with a group. Mainly thanks to our awesome waitress Victoria. We loved the food so much we came back the following day just by ourselves.   Great chicken. Excellent fries. Amazing mixed drinks.   We are definitely making this a regular spot whenever we come to Vegas.

lb0nTCgOoqnfz3myZ7KFwg.text: I found this place through a bunch of posts on Instagram that looked amazing. It did not disappoint! Fries were crispy, chicken was tender, just a great experience overall. I highly recommend.

MBTiSZe3epiRAg19eqWaRQ.text: Definitely one of the best fried chicken eateries in Las Vegas! I've been here several times and the 30 minute drive is worth it. The parking lot is huge but good luck finding a close spot, just forget driving in circles and head to the back. What gets me is the people inside always appear to be people watching as you walk past the big glass windows.  The menu is simple. Get fried chicken or a chicken sandwich. Both are spectacular. Definitely try the fries with the works. I always order the blue ribbon sandwich with cheddar and an extra patty (huge but delicious). The sauces are OK. Seating has never been a problem, but the seats themselves I hate. They're like sticky picnic tables. You cannot wipe them down enough! Despite always leaving full and guilty about the huge caloric intake....I always come back.

uqqHpUXvvT_-Yrd0EXPXwg.text: Who doesn't love a chicken sandwich.. especially when it's bigger than your mouth! There are multiple locations but the location on the strip is perfect for a meal after a night out. They have indoor and outdoor seating if you need some fresh air. The Bloody Mary was amazing and I highly recommend! The best part is you can always take it to go if you don't finish before your meal. There are many sandwich options and I don't think you could go wrong. The proportions are big but don't forget to add a side of fries. They also have a few different sauces you can add which are on the tables The range in flavor and spices. Don't pass this place up when you're on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D_HOvxN6USv_-fOiHrCZlA.text: The chicken was good but it didn't really feel like a nice crunch or flaky or anything. Also the bread falls apart kind of easy and takes away from the sandwich. That was all okay to deal with but i also had the cheesy supreme and with a name like that I figured it had a lot of cheese but it didn't. It was 2 choices of cheese and it was an ok amount.  However, the loaded fries were amazing! Plenty of cheese and nice bacon but the addition of he sour cream it brings was soo good!   Prices were good with everything being at about $8 or $9 but honestly for a place known for the chicken, I was blown away by the fries and the chicken was just good to me. Worth trying but not sure of worth repeating. Maybe getting chicken pieces and not sandwiches would be better

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple and chicken in one sandwich, cheese supreme as mine. Loaded fries on the side

m5bwLmCCjjYOXt-4G0SK9Q.text: Chicken had seasoning on both the skin anddddddd the actual chicken! Imagine such a concept lol I ordered the dark meat 2 piece which was great.  Not a fan of the skinny fries but that should not stop anyone from coming since this is a chicken joint! I have heard their smoked Mac and Cheese was popping but I haven't tried it myself.  If you are in the Bally's plaza stop by to experience the chicken.

Ll3-0UNNHlTb4MN-T0trsg.text: Stumbled upon this place by accident after going to Drais Dayclub. Their chicken is very moist and amazing!! I got The Blue Ribbon sandwich. It was a good sized burger. This burger with the sweet sauce found on the table was the best combo. My friend got 2 fried chickens and I thought that was more juicy and flavorful than the burger. The fries are also thinly sliced and addicting to eat!

nWenfsrWNyPhxLMV3_QC9Q.text: The chicken breast was ok and so was the mac & cheese, although I'm not sure what it means that the cheesy favorite is called "smoked."  It tasted like baked mac & cheese to me. But the customer service difference is always in the details. Both of my forks melted which was weird. The first one turned to jelly when I tried to break up the chicken breast. The second started curling up as I ate the macaroni. Maybe the food was actually great but having this weird, bent fork in my mouth or trying to use it to get the last crumbs kind of ruined it for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forks by Edvard Munch or Salvador Dali?

wc-664W3VmpR5ufvGO_A3Q.text: This place was hard to find at first. I live in the nearby Las Vegas area and didn't know where to park as well. This restaurant is located in front of the Bally's hotel in an area called the grand bazaar. If you park in Bally's parking lot and you are a resident here, you can park for free for up to 24 hours using your valid Nevada state ID.  Now, about the food here. I would have to say that the chicken is very tasty and tender. There's not so much batter taking over the chicken experience. They seem to use homemade pickles in their sandwiches. I would recommend this place as I enjoyed the food tremendously. However, I would not recommend the lemonade or the shakes. The price of their shakes is $5.95 which to me is ridiculous. You could go somewhere else afterwards and get better dessert for a lot less. The lemonade tastes like the powder mix not like real lemonade. I was very disappointed with it. Also, when I was trying to locate this restaurant, I tried calling but no one answered, another negative to this place. But overall I would give this place four stars for the flavor and tenderness of their chicken. Check them out and let us know what you think!  Update, I am now a vegan and came here with my family for lunch. I had the kale salad and sweet potato fries. They were pretty good in spite that they're known for their chicken. I was hopeful that I could at least have those two things. I would probably have the salad again, it was tasty after all.

47JfRWgJecvNtHYom8L4tg.text: One of my favorite for a quick meal in vegas!  I am from Texas, so I want flavor and spice!  The sauces turn the chicken from great to amazing, and the loaded fries were delicious!! My husband had one of the sandwiches, and it was really good.  Great location, very casual for a quick snack!!

NwGr6T9BaxlR7Pa4v9MDeg.text: I love that the chicken is all natural! This place is really passionate about using natural ingredients in their cooking and beverages. Mike at the strip location was soo nice, informative and hospitable.

oGm4Qc6KJUzhWq1ZvMdrTQ.text: When we went to Vegas. We couldn't help but eat here four times. They have the best chicken and fries as well as dozens of choices to choose from. We have zero complaints and the service here was literally Outstanding. They went above and beyond for not only us but everyone around us each time we went. I truly wish they would open one in Orlando because we would be there all the time. You will not regret going here.

q2VUlrKls5XyohecoLZN-Q.text: Where have you been all my life (well....since my plane landed in Las Vegas)?  The bad news is I found out this gem my last day in Vegas.  I devoured my Drum Line and the hubby killed his chicken tenders.  Drinks are on point!

IVSV1guh2PChLXQcnvg24g.text: The food is really good, especially the sandwiches, but good lord it takes forever to get your food here

WYD7pyAafs4sRntrBGs9Mw.text: VIVA las chicken. Probably the best fried chicken in Las Vegas. Fantastic service as well. There was a slight hiccup with my order, and the situation was rectified 10 fold. Go eat some CHICKEN!!!

Sa_oQ4H8DATNqovZDv-thw.text: Best fried chicken I have ever had.  i just love the crispy fried skin.  Nothing like it anywhere else.

bhyKpZIb6V1Cw0RJ8-ZMhg.text: Got here with my girlfriend, $8 for burger, and $5 for fries with works (small). we ordered the one with cheese, and another one with  hot pepper. Some people will think that it is too expensive 8 dollars for a single sandwich, but I kind of felt that the price was reasonable. When you go onto Jack in the Box, you will expect to pay around 6-7 dollars for a sandwich. If I think about that, since this place is in Strip and the chicken was fresh too. We enjoyed our time there, food was great, there are seats outside too, so you may be able to get some breeze while you are eating there.

OEsoGOWDDAmb9jf8xHRfkQ.text: The fried chicken was on point, crispy and fresh. French fries were thin cut and delicious. Service was exceptional.

23N0eKAW0a28-4AZ0EgzMA.text: Man everyone talks about Yardbird but this place is on a whole entire level better then them

w-rde7mkawwzZPZihPkV0A.text: Ordered two chicken sandwiches they were good, the fries were perfect nice and crispy. Great place on the strip for a quick bite

S5RXapr1TwQFkQkJ5fXxaw.text: The chicken was hot a juicy but I think it needed more seasoning and not all that paprika they place on the tenders. If our are hungry this will hit the spot when you don't want to wait at Wahlburger next door.

BVTZjdYk39cHAkGJDnhHEw.text: I was surprised. I had chichen tenders. Chicken was excellent quality no fillers. Cooked to perfection.  I'd say better than Chick-fil-A. Plenty of fries.  Skimpy on side of slaw.

022jIGkn63xpgxITOX9JcQ.text: Delicious chicken platters a little pricey but decent amount. 3 tender platter $13. I ate hush puppies and the smokehouse MAC and it was great.

00N4BmmO23utvKsZxngUqg.text: These by far are the best chicken wings and sandwich I've had in my life. Seriously, I came back twice in one day. Tiffany is the best bar tender and was awesome.

6R2HD8vfxlOAeBTOg8wNmA.text: I was walking around when I smelled something awesome. I looked to my left and saw this fried chicken joint. Couldn't help my self and try it out. All I have to say is the fridge chicken was straight fire!! Most def coming back here when Im in Vegas again.

sCuZon7Qakru_Wn38PeNRw.text: Great fried chicken stop for fast delicious food on the strip. Bartender was really friendly and made us a bomb boozy milkshake!

L3SDmKUYe1HOPz9z6UQM_w.text: Great place best part was the fries and all the different types of honey dipping sauces.

IdDv9G9mzPUViPUOBjghFQ.text: Best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had. Sodas are local and awesome and you can't miss with fries with the works. If you a want quick meal this is the place.

DUVrgERESvQIcUC8tp25LQ.text: Best fried chicken in town. Fries are amazing as well. Takes a while to get food and service was a little weird, but the food made up for it!

aQz3JUB0vQjXiiNvY3s-Mw.text: Food was delicious. Service sucks tho! Like 6-8 people "working" and it took about 15 mins for 2 chicken tenders and fries! The food was bomb but come on in what world does "fast food" take that long. If they cut down on the talking and did their job that would be nice.

RhEND5pNLoOyJqZhGJ5bsg.text: Didn't end up eating here. Prices were out of this world! Should be shown as $$$$ small place and very little place to sit.

X3hEUr64m7lxrcFBV6kg9g.text: The food was good, but the service was horrible. Ordered our food and had to wait almost 20 minutes for entire table to get orders called. It was done and ready just didn't get called and got cold. There was plenty of people working but none of them seemed to be doing much....

9XR9Zf-JxZoq1q4Nv8LwCA.text: The food is pretty good but it is way too expensive for fast food. Even for the Strip. $16 for four pieces of fried chicken? $13 for a chicken sandwich? No thanks. The inside is very small and there are a few tables outside too. Maybe just try cleaning them once in a while!

k4G5tcC1EmmxsA-Lb0DKCQ.text: As I cherish the times I've had in sin City, the aromatic fragrance of sweet, deep fried chicken fills my lungs. Many who wander claim to not be lost, in my travels I stand tall and admit, I have been and will be lost throughout my adventures. Arriving at this chicken joint I'm greeted with humble and inviting personalities from all across the world... The Vegas world. I decided to scarf down a royal wing food entree which consisted of 6 individually picked wings. Succulent pieces of prime poultry. I drizzled every sauce I could get my paws on, and boy.. what a great decision I have made. One of the few good choices I've made in my life. I'm glad to say choosing blue ribbon fried chicken has made my life a little more tolerable. I take my wig off for this place and will return to feast another time. 5/5 will try again.

rmma9j2BAdw0l5Bc0TwHBw.text: Came in here a few days ago with my family and it was just a bad experience ! First as soon as we walked in one of the girls ( Hispanic looking with black hair with the ugly eyeliner ) she right away assumed we only speaked Spanish ! She walked over to the African American girl letting her know we spoke Spanish, she came over and asked us if we needed someone to speak Spanish to us! I told her NO we speak English ! She then turned over to the other girl and told her they don't need someone to speak to them in Spanish !!!!! How the fuck are you going to assume someone doesn't talk English !!!! How small minded do u have to be to assume before even talking to us or to even greet us just seconds after walking in that door! Other than that the other lady was nice food was okay till I found a hair in the chicken !!!! I was just done with this place we just walked out! First and last time ever walking In here!

gifcpSqGC6-GhtEeHqtyHg.text: Perfect fried chicken!!!  If you are craving for some fried chicken and are bored of all those expensive restaurants in Vegas casinos, this is definitely a place to check out.  Their chicken is perfectly seasoned and crispy on the outside while juicy on the inside.  A lot of place have fried chicken that tends to be dry from over cooking, this is not that.  You can also try it with different types of sauces, but I preferred it just like that.  The sides are ok.  Beware the place is generally crowded and you might have to sit outside.

jnBLxGdTyzbhxON2jMCeKQ.text: Good food but customer service is horrendous. The whole staff gave the vibe that nobody wants to be there.

vn-A0EgmwX2ulfSuoNzNew.text: Chicken is ok.. I got the 4 pcs mix, combo seems to include fries and coleslaw.  The coleslaw is the same itty bitty size as the container I asked for to get some ketchup to go.  Food seems overpriced and it took a minute to wait for.    I would go back if someone was treating.  I ordered a side of Mac n cheese this is ok value is not worth the price.

beI5wzbt8iQK-uRLF5PEdw.text: Really good sandwich here. I enjoyed every bite. I was sick that day and couldn't taste anything. But I was able to taste the this chicken. The only thing I am not crazy about is their seating. It's kinda difficult to find comfortable seating here.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids meal on the right. Huge drumstick.
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No filter needed

y13dPSldns5qieM5MLTr3g.text: Where do I begin? Let me start with the overall taste of the fried chicken since that's what's obviously drawing people to this place. It was good but not as mind blowing as the experience of getting it turned out to be. We got there around 11 pm on a Sunday. There were about 6 people ahead of us in line. The line took about 30 minutes to get to us. We're immediately told by the girl taking orders that all they have is chicken and we can only order chicken. Mind you a fresh tray of fries just came out. I ask if we can order fried chicken livers and she said no. Only fried chicken! In any case, we end up ordering 2 chicken strips at $3.50 each and a breast at $5.50 along with a chicken sandwich. The total comes to around $25! It now takes another 20 minutes for us to get our food. Mind you, the chickens already all premade and sitting right behind the counter ready to throw into a bag right next to a huge tray of now cold fries that we weren't allowed to order while they were still hot! The cashier continues telling people all they can order is chicken.  My number is called and I go to get my food. It's not to go and I tell the guy it's supposed to be, to which he responds, "that's not what the ticket says"! Anyways... We begin walking down the strip and I pull out the strips to munch on while walking back to our hotel and they are kid meal sized tiny! I feel like I've seen bigger strips when I've order nuggets from other places! Definitely not worth $3.50 each! They have a family meal which feeds 4 and comes with 12 strips! Truth be told, I could easily put away all 12 of those strips and last I checked I wasn't an entire family! The chicken sandwich wasnt great at all. You could tell that the chaos happening inside the restaurant greatly affected how this sandwich was rushed to put together. It was soggy and lacked flavor. Long story short... The fried chicken was good but the experience makes me never want to go back especially considering the thousands of other restaurant options all around this one!

_YXUKae0rUtiTAKGm-qOMg.text: This place was okay.  I've been to both this location and the one in downtown Summerlin.  Both places were fine but failed to impress.    There was limited outdoor and indoor seating.  I could see it being a problem in the colder months.  Service was great, and the employees in the front and servers were all pleasant.  I ended up getting the dark chicken combo.  For both locations, the chicken was whelming, while the fries were super tasty.  I wouldn't come back though, when there's a multitude of low cost comfort food places around the strip and around town.  If you're near either location and want fried chicken, it's not a bad bet.  Otherwise, I'd make the drive to Raisin Cane's for both price, quantity and flavor.

This time Me and my friend were looking for something healthy and cheap, and we found out this place also sells salads, me and my griend loved their salad had really fresh chicken, variety of vegetables and i loved their dressing!!!  We got the House Salad with lemon dressing

sKKujSUzg9Dktl8Cx9NTzQ.text: After wanting to come I finally made it in today.  Let me start off by saying that the service was good. Employees were courteous and funny.  Now I'll start with the best part, the Nutella shake. It was soooooo good! Not overly nutella(Ey) it was just perfect.  We upgraded our order to a combo so it came with fries and a side of coleslaw. Their sauce is pretty delicious, the chicken was cooked perfectly BUT I feel like the pickled cucumbers overwhelm the taste of the sauce and the chicken. :( Overall it was good tho.

32X2MBkRRVxgfV6IJOIFGg.text: Everyone raved about this place so I had to try it out while waiting for a friend outside of Bally's.  Honestly, it is a cut above the fast food places and a cut below any serviceable restaurant. The service was slow, the staff seemed irritated with the customers (probably deserved given the location).  One of the servers acted like it was a huge favor for him to get an extra ranch sauce for a customer.   They do serve alcohol but at tourist prices.

7XeqrF8m7eYK8oNkC6U7FA.text: Pretty good for a chain! I just got the basic sandwich with the spicy mayo on the side to give it a little kick. It tasted really nice and was pretty quick. We went on a Monday night and it was not busy!

yiWQW_ZLiz_eAjzIg2Ou5Q.text: I have to say this is my favorite chicken sandwich restaurant I have ever been too. My girlfriend gave up red meat years ago. When she bit into her sandwich she said in excitement, "this is the in n out of chicken!" As I bit into mine I knew exactly what she was talking about. The chicken was crispy and tender. Everything in our sandwiches complemented itself. Definitely going back. A little pricy for just a chicken sandwich but i would rather pay a little more for a quality sandwich. 20 bucks for two sandwiches no combo. Good nonetheless my go to spot

yzxpzdWr_Qhpr-dsVxyzlQ.text: One of the best chicken sandwiches I've had!   It's tucked away behind a small plaza and there isn't any easy parking spots nearby, but it is definitely worth the walk. They have a bar window outside for easy access, but in terms of size for seating it is pretty small. There is seating outside however!  I ordered one of their signature burgers (sandwiches) The Blue Ribbon and their dirty fries.  The burger had delicious buns and the chicken was seasoned well and super crispy!  They also give you the choice of many sauces (about 6) which can suit your taste needs from spicy to sweet to savory. The dirty fries are a must try! Absolutely delicious! It includes bacon and Cajun seasoning. My girlfriend also ordered their cheesy supreme burger and really loved it.   Would definitely come back again!!

We got the bird combo with substituted the fries for sweet potato fries and had leftovers because we are only 2. it was amazing!!! The chicken was so juicy and succulent, even the leftovers were still amazing.  Will definitely come back when we take vacation to Vegas again. Please come to So.Cal!!!!!! jCqdwtaJ2VN87YdOigjNSg.text: Don't come here. The people who reviewed this place have no taste palette...Chick fil a is 100x better and more flavorful than this place. I came here starving on an empty stomach & I left full but with a strong hate for this place. The chicken tenders are chewy and the the mac n cheese is tasteless. Boxed mac n cheese is better. The best thing are the fries....oh yeah and the sauces are garbage. 10/10 would never come here again.

bu70KLWaYGpowIFjLfXnuw.text: Ate here on a whim and my only regret is that there is no location in LA. We had The Bird (2 wings, 2 thighs, two breasts). The breading was insanely crispy and seasoned perfectly, while the chicken was juicy and steaming hot. Also, 10/10 hard iced tea.

1t6OuoDCwMwKD1WNmJCSyA.text: We walked by here looking for the Lush store. My girlfriend love chicken so what the heck. We ended up destroying the chicken, it was fantastic. The fries are also splendid, the portion was huge.

QTZRaU72pLHWy60ObIUOUw.text: * If you're having trouble finding this place - it's in the rows of shops outside Bally's, known as the Grand Bazaar. This is a popular stop in New York, and I'm happy to see it on The Strip (.. and Summerlin)!  Basics: - Order at the counter and sit down or take it to go - Price Range / Person: $12 - $18 (without alcohol) - Any meal listed + side should fill you up - Classics include drumsticks and the Firebird sandwich (there are also seasonal specials not-so-obviously posted around) - Their sauces are great to amplify flavor profile that you enjoy  Critiques of this location:  - The buns on my sandwich was cold and flavorless; it seriously put a damper on my meal, so I just took them off - No one wiping down the tables consistently; did not happen in the hour that I was there

RpYay2CjJCkxZqALCO60HQ.text: Nice staff Bad chicken. I ordered the wings fries and pickled cucumbers. PICKLED CUCUMBERS ARE DELICIOUS! chicken undercooked and small. KFC gives bigger and better wings. Seasoning not so bad. Also ordered chicken sandwich (forgot the name) it came with 2cheeses. Another fail. Bread was hard chicken breast was good size but not seasoned well and not moist. It's a No for me. I would honestly come back to only get the cucumbers again though

VRG8ohZyG_3_8tfp1gJzyg.text: Great food and great atmosphere. They have plenty to choose from on their menu and your food is prepared quickly. The chicken was fresh and crispy. It was a little pricey but worth it. They give you large portions so be prepared to box it up for later or share with someone. It is also in a great location with cool places around it.

CzmSn3aY0KApN9WOohTTsg.text: A good 3 stars, the chicken is decent and the bacon cheddar fries were good. The only complaint is the service. I'm not sure if I would recommend this to a friend but I would stop by if it wasn't busy.

fOz08ttveJ0zHWV-0e5x4Q.text: This review is an honest one and not written by a disgruntled customer. I was very excited to try this place and it was highly rated on yelp. The restaurant was not busy when we arrived however it was very dirty. All of the tables, the floor, condiment station and even the outdoor seating areas were dirty. We went to the counter to order and it was apparent none of the employees wanted to be there. We were not greeted and when we did order the employee wouldn't make eye contact with us. That is very awkward when that happens. The food came out fairly quickly and looked really really good but unfortunately that was not how it tasted. I tried the Blue Ribbon Original. The was so much sauce on it you couldn't taste the chicken and then they piled a stack of wet lettuce on the bottom and it soaked right through the bun. The bun was not even edible. Tried the fries and they were way overcooked and had no salt or seasoning at all. I don't know if that's how the food normally taste here but it wasn't worth the money especially when you drop $50 for the family.

SInQwbRXG1gLwQAlqqiobw.text: Affordable and tasty.  I like that you can buy pieces a la carte and not have to buy a combo with fries and coleslaw.  I just ate my 2 pieces cold from the fridge and they were great. The line here is usually nuts but we got lucky last night with a short wait and quick service to pick up the food. There is a little area inside to grab wet naps, honey, habanero sauce, bbq sauce, etc.  Go all the way around the loop of the food alley and it is at the end. No complaints and cannot wait to go again to try it hot and fresh. Will try the fries next time too. Ordered: 1 drumstick and 1 thigh.  Crispy. Seasoned right. Delicious.

_UXIsFKajtCJPhix52pSuA.text: I think, wait, no....   I KNOW that this was hands down the BEST fried chicken tenders that I have ever had!  Extremely flavorful and juicy and the fries were excellent as well. The restaurant is located in the fun little food court outside of Bally's, center of the strip. It was very clean and the employees seem to love their jobs and execute beautiful food!

gwONjN83Y6_yqr2QUaLbwA.text: Tasty cajun seasoning with the right amount of crisp so that the chicken stays nice and moist. I got a thigh and drumstick a la cart because it's Vegas and there are a million other things on the strip. No frills fast food chicken joint great for a quick bite so you can continue sinning.

-YWmxlakmBMF2rBZs1jtiw.text: I'm no fried chicken connoisseur but I've had my fair share and I've gotta say that Blue Ribbon Chicken is the best fried chicken I've ever had. Couple the chicken with the excellent service we received and it was a homerun.   We checked this place out after exploring the strip on Christmas Day 2018. All of the employees working the front of the house should really be commended for an excellent job. All of the young ladies working expo and the young man working the cashier were very friendly and helpful and not rude or spiteful despite having to work on Christmas Day. I cannot stress enough the positive affect it has on an experience to have pleasant employees helping you.  I took it upon myself to thank them for their good work and wished them a Merry Christmas.   I had their signature Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich and we also tried their 2 piece boneless strip basket with fries and coleslaw. The sandwich was one of the best chicken sandwiches I've had. Soft bun, well seasoned chicken, pickled cucumber, shredded lettuce and special sauce make this sandwich a hit. The chicken strips have their signature spice blend which has a unique and delicious flavor that pairs well with the fried chicken.  Their fires are the hand-cut type but not the ones that are soggy and greasy. Their fries are crisp and thin and delicious. Coleslaw was your standard slaw, but not the creamy kind. More of a vinegar base with a touch of mayo.   They have a selection of sauces and such to go with your chicken like bbq sauce, hot sauce, honey, chipotle sauce and of course ranch upon request.  Their  ranch has a vinegary tang to it that goes well with the fried chicken.  I will definitely be returning to Blue Ribbon when I come back to Vegas.

-TnGsT8dUrPiuSCgKEzQBA.text: O-V-E-R-R-A-T-E-D.   This place is over priced, for below mediocre food- not my cup of tea. Let's get straight to the point, would I recommend this place to friends and family? Nope. Am I running back for seconds? Double nope. I've had better fried chicken, better chicken sandwiches, and better French fries at fast food places (ie: Popeyes, chick-Fil-A, church's chicken, etc).   Once again, I was super excited to try this place seeing all the yummy pictures on Yelp. I was immediately disappointed because upon ordering the chick behind the reg said they longer sell the Smoke Burger (burger with Mac n Cheese), tears. I then decided to try 2 pieces of chicken and some chicken sandwich.   The dark meat meal consisted of a drum, a thigh, coleslaw and French fries. The coleslaw was disgusting, super watery- no flavor. The fries weren't that hot, with a texture like they've been sitting out. The chicken? The skin was the best part, 4/5- but the actual meat was watery with no real memorable flavor. Blah...Tears.  I then moved onto my chicken burger, The Firebird. Don't let this burger fool you. It may look good, but it doesn't taste good. ***Biggest pet peeve...my bun was cold- it broke and crumbled after just TWO bites! Please take the time and peep my picture to see what I'm talkin' bout, it's so dissatisfying. I haaaaaate when this happens, like freal?   Ready for the icing on the cake? My hubby felt sick about an hour after eating here. Not cool.   Seriously, they're so many other places worth visiting on the strip. I'm not running back for a second visit anytime soon.

e_YmDyXGvVn-UsmS40zeag.text: Who can say no to fried chicken? We sure can't. Finally, made our way out to Blue Ribbon on another spur of the moment and seeing mouth watering pics on Instagram. Blue ribbon has a few restaurants and sushi, but we wanted to try the chicken. Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken, is located in the middle of the strip in the Grand Bazaar Shops at the Bally.   You cannot miss this cute little place as it has a huge sign just to fit the flashy lights in Vegas. So first time here, and just like most places you order and you pick up at the counter. We came right before dinner and during the middle of the week so the place was also not crowded. As we approached the counter, there was an awesome guy who helped us out. I did not get his name as he got us to save a little bit on our bill. We ended up ordering: the bbq pulled chicken sandwich with regular fries and a sugar cream soda for myself. My fiance got The Pit and fries with the works with the ginger ale. The guy at the register gave us two The Works fries discounted compared to getting one for $14.75. Kudos for making the suggestion.  If you are not a sandwich person, they do have tenders, wings, breasts, thigh and drumstick options. Their sides, all look amazing as well. They also have shakes and boozy shakes (alcohol mixed into your choice of shake!)   We decided to eat inside since there were not many people. Time for food was just as expected. So the pulled chicken sandwich, pretty good. Chicken was juicy, that day it was perfectly seasoned. The size was perfect as well, not to big or too small and filling for my stomach. The fries, regular and the works were better than most fries I ever tasted. Regular fries perfectly cooked and crisp, not burnt. The Works, omg bacon for days with lotsa of cheese, and sour cream! Bite after bite melts in your mouth and worth getting. My fiance loved his The Pit (had cheddar, chicken, bacon, and bbq sauce).  The sandwich was so good, he wanted more.   Overall, we definitely will come back! Hoping they open one up off the strip in the Henderson area. We would definitely try and stop by every other week. Customer service was on point and the wait time was perfect. Will see ya soon!

-URWkD78tcUz0SgbAfi1kQ.text: As i walk through the Grand Bazaar shops i always smell the aroma of Blue Ribbon, not only was it enough to make me want to try it ...it made me CRAVE it.  When i went in to finally cure this longing desire, you can imagine it was very crowded. The menu prices give you a bit of sticker shock, but the aroma makes it nearly impossible to walk out empty handed....what do you do??- The voices chanted "Get the chicken!"  The chicken was indeed very very VERY tasty, the right amount of spice and perfectly fried. While it beats any of the larger chain chicken places, it does leave you wanting more because you do not get as much portion wise.  Oh, they talked me into getting the fries with the bacon and sour cream -that was good too.  They have different sauces that you can serve yourself- i liked the jalapeno sauce.   On the way out i caught a glimpse of what looked like this pair of futuristic self compacting garbage cans!

ioqcjSHyNigc4o34_mUIDA.text: Most of there pictures show chicken sandwiches but they don't even sell them anymore disappointed

7wgdj67bGpfTWeQN8bZ9Lg.text: First night in Vegas and we just checked into Bally's, so now it's time to explore. We step out into the grand bazaars and one of the first places you see and smell is Blue Ribbon. It says "Fried Chicken" big as day with lit up drumsticks as a border around the place so I went in with high expectations. Any place bold enough to have CHICKEN LIGHTS has to be good, right?!   We ordered the chicken sandwich, wings and the fries with the works. My bill ran kind if high but l didn't care because once again, CHICKEN LIGHTS!  Got my wings and they were tiny and very bland. The only thing that kind of saved them were the assortment of sauces they have.  The chicken sandwich was good size but also bland with the main bit of flavor coming from the pickle inside of it.  The fries were probably my favorite thing. They came with bacon, cheese and sour cream and had delicious flavor but they got kind of dry at the end because the toppings weren't throughout the fries.  I really wanted this place to be good but unfortunately it didn't meet my expectations. It was overpriced and under flavored. The CHICKEN LIGHTS, they betrayed me.

We waited for the doors to open and was the first customer to order. Our order took about 10 minutes but I think it's because we ordered the Beak to Butt and I think they had to fry those while our 4 piece mix was ready!   It was worth the wait either way. They have a lot of different sauces for you to dip but I did like the wasabi honey and their version of bbq sauce!   Good food and excellent service!

z78J8WG_27xK91VO1iKpkw.text: After viewing their Instagram page and reading all of the reviews, I had SUPER high hopes for Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken. With my mom visiting, we trekked all the way down to the Strip specifically so I could try the "State Fair"- a fried chicken sandwich with a funnel cake on it!! When i saw it on IG, I knew that I HAD to have one- I'm a huge fan of sweet and savory combinations.  Blue Ribbon is kind of the chicken version of In and Out. Order at the counter, they call your name when it's ready, and there's a small seating area inside and outside. One really nice touch is the ice water already ready for you in plastic cups.   The woman who took our order was friendly and helpful, so we started off on the right foot. But it took FOREVER for our orders to be ready. I knew it would take some time, but it was really quite awhile. When our orders finally arrived, there was a bit of a mixup and the counter people had to scramble to remedy it (basically they put the wrong sides with the wrong chicken).  Ok, most importantly- the food!  State Fair- the chicken itself was great. Hot, juicy, tender, well seasoned. The bread was also great. But the funnel cake added absolutely nothing to the sandwich. It needed powdered sugar, or maple syrup or something to get the sweet going with the savory. I ended up having to add honey to it to get what I wanted from it.   Smoked Mac and Cheese- pretty good! Very cheesy, noodles were well cooked. Could have used a bit more seasoning.   Loaded Fries- meh. We had to ask for a side of sour cream. It was supposed to come with it, but there was barely any on there.  My boyfriend didn't enjoy his Cheesy Chicken Sandwich that much, he said the chicken wasn't seasoned enough for him. Also, he ordered his sandwich with applewood smoked bacon,  and it came with bacon bits on it- which no one informed us that's how they do it. He was pretty annoyed about that! Bacon bits on a sandwich??   All in all, it was fine, and filling, but not really worth a trip down to the Strip just for it. The hunt continues!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jDOnA8UTGGcwlquaX4_phg.text: Came here for late dinner and found this! Simple and quick notes to remember: Staff: not too friendly. Cashier spoke very soft and didn't seem to throw suggestions when I asked. Food: chicken was great! I ordered a 6 wing combo which came with fries and cole slaw. Wings were perfect! Unfortunately, they don't serve the sandwiches anymore... bummer Environment: felt clean. Did not seem messy. Their sauce bar has a lot of other condiments ! Check it out   The pricing is a bit expensive but doable.

ZoSKO8w9UCpFiyvgwmHezQ.text: If I didn't follow all these foodie profiles on IG, I probably would never have came across BRFC. No regrets! So glad this was my first meal in Vegas for this visit. It's tucked away in the Grand Bazaar, so it took a while to find it.  I usually don't like fried chicken, but put it in a burger and I'm all for it. Like most places, you gotta try the original. I got the signature blue ribbon chicken, fries, and tried their wings just for the heck of it. The chicken came out piping hot, fresh from the fryer. It was juicy and the sauce paired well with the chicken. Fries were crispy. Cole slaw was.. cole slaw.  There always seems to be a line, but it moves pretty quick. Not many seats inside, but plenty outside. On hot days, the AC inside definitely helps. As well as the ice cold water they offer.  The walk from Mandalay Bay to Blue Ribbon was worth it. The food coma after, not so much. They offer unique sandwiches every month, so definitely check them out.

Zanc4d_1JTvOUbASA6ZJng.text: Great chicken! I highly recommend the #1 meal with their signature Blue Ribbon chicken! The sandwich is perfect from the buns to the lettuce to the chicken itself.   Service could be slow depending on the rush, the restaurant is fairly small, and customer service is passive at best, but the chicken is GREAT!  There are water misters outside if you can't get a seat inside. Try one of their sauces! My favorite is the chipotle honey (orange bottle), it has the perfect sweet and spice blend!

ZWxaGW1paCoF-3S_HpCHYw.text: I found this place on Yelp! This was our first time here. We love fried chicken and ordered the Family Style whole chicken meal. The chicken was very very good, yes two very goods, crispy on the outside and the meat was well cooked inside, not over cooked. We were too excited to eat, so no pictures. Fries were crispy. We tried the chicken in hot sauce, sirachi, bbq sauce, wasabi bbq, wasabi honey, and honey that was on the condiments counter.  The coleslaw was okay. The strawberry and chocolate milkshakes were thick and tasted like real chocolate and strawberry milkshakes :).

x_Nusb0AkOF8bR_unadXEQ.text: The chicken has no taste. I ordered the two piece tenders meal. The tenders were juicy but it made the batter soggy and the chicken just didn't have any flavor. Even dunking it in sauce didn't help. Their chicken has potential but they need to learn how to season the meat. The coleslaw lacked flavor. It was tangy but had no taste. Just very disappointing. I wouldn't recommend it.

WGTK7TNYjcGqaEgDhKMUVg.text: This place is overrated and I was very dissatisfied with the service and taste. Some friends and I ate here on a late Monday night ordered some strips and chicken meals. The three piece tender meal came with small sized strips and some fries. The chicken was okay in flavor and was soft on the outside instead of crunchy. Wouldn't recommend this place at all. Paid well over $50 for such a disappointment.

T3oyB8HYHYwpTc8eevSlIQ.text: French fries: tasted like old oil. saturated with oil dried out and inedible.  Chicken: Juicy and nice crunch. Lacking in flavor in the meat. Can anyone fry chicken anymore with seasoning?   Overall: Would never come back. Tasted like how Popeyes used to taste with less/little/no flavor. This is for people who never eat fried chicken and dont know what it is supposed to taste like. If your grandmother ever made you fried chicken, then you will hate this place.

f9sH-9OZr2gkC-HGcUDNSA.text: 30 minute wait in a Thursday night around 1 am. The food was good, they ran out of wings but not worth the 30 minute wait. Would come back but heard it's almost that long of a wait during the day. Workers are very slow.

42KjI7RQHkNgBbS5d9T2Ew.text: Me and my bf both got the ranchers and fries! The fries were very good and so were the sandwiches! Everything was hot and fresh!

bhwEZTaVNIjLOdspO8JNdQ.text: Delicious wings and the chicken strip are spectacular. Great late night spot in Vegas

oYe0SXTHaBhfyI26W0EEWA.text: Great little place to grab lunch and a drink. The staff was friendly and answered our questions since it was our first time. The breading on the chicken is flavorful, the mac and cheese was the perfect amount of gooey. Good placement right on the strip.

_MV7x36MDvxniVslFHxIMQ.text: The fried chicken sandwiches are crispy juicy deliciousness. Put wasabi honey on everything! The fried chicken itself wasn't amazing but it was crisp and fresh and juicy. The sides are pretty good and it's pretty quick eats.

efJPWD9VrBDPi8LC2lx2rA.text: I had the firebird sandwich.. spicy just how I like it.. the chicken was good & juicy.. I also had the fries with the works.. I had the small size & the portion was huge!!!! Very shareable portion.. the fries were very cheesy & a lot of bacon.

I wanted to take a picture but I ate it so fast I forgot. Anyway, please give this place a try if you're In Vegas.

z6fRGBVcBb07Z60JE36Q7g.text: This place was amazing! I had the Blue Ribbon chicken sandwich with fries and was blown away by the taste of it. The chicken was moist, well seasoned, excellent breading. The condiments on the sandwich added to the flavor. Love this place and will go again when I am back to Vegas.

YDSCAVTVJhsswRwROhqfWw.text: This is in the newish food/drink outdoor complex right in front of Bally's. It's near/next to Wahlburgers and Giordano's. Towards the end where the escalator's taking you up to Bally's are.   There's a small line even at 1:30am on a Friday night. Nice. I tried the original blue ribbon chicken sandwich. Pretty standard with lettuce, tomatoes, pickled cucumbers (they refuse to call them pickles), blue ribbon sauce (a ranchy/thousand island kind of thing), on a nice buttery toasted bun. The sandwich is well balanced and the vegetable ingredients were really fresh. I thought the fried chicken patty was a bit dry, and a little under seasoned. A friend of mine had tenders and thought the same thing for the chicken. I did enjoy the sandwich overall.

h-JJiA_XtFe5fakssu7GYQ.text: Came here a few weeks back with my bro after a long night to meet up with some friends.  Location - Located in the shopping area in front of Ballys.  Venue  - Place is chill with a indoor dining area, little bar top area, and a outside walk up bar.   Food - Food was good and had good taste didn't get that wow I expected from the hype , but good stuff.   Service - Staff was friendly and did a job at getting  our order served after having to remind them about our drinks and getting some condiments.  Price - Regular going rate for food on the strip.

n_ME4xYZ6J5aLKlvIgRXwA.text: Overall this is very good but not as good as I was expecting.  I sat at the counter and the service was excellent.  The fries with the works were really good and I also liked the difference flavour of the cola - it is made with cane sugar.  However the star of the show - the original chicken sandwich - was just okay - nothing special.  I don't know if I would be back.

-qIbok8a7satY_MQEJYQiQ.text: Delicious! I had the cheesy supreme and a small order of sweet potato fries. The fries were so good and crunchy, but the sandwich was the real star of the show! It was moist and flavorful with a bit of a crunch. I enjoyed trying all the different honey sauces. My favorite was the chipotle. Be careful with the honey, a few of them exploded all over the place when we squeezed the tube.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aky7pMRJhAwnP80z0xKhrg.text: We are here a couple of times & the chicken is really good, the fries are good and the cole slaw is good.  Also the service is good and timely. I like everything about this place.

7IRM87i_18zT4fnS4K46lA.text: I really have mixed emotions about this place. I heard about it from a personality on the Food Network so I thought it was a must have. Therefore, I made the trip.  Upon walking in it is loud and a bit small but there is seating outside. The next thing I noticed were the prices. There were close to Five Guys prices and it was over $30 for a beer, fries, two sandwiches and hush puppies. The sum of my Ranch sandwich was not impressive. It was a bit too much bread and I attribute this to the thin piece of chicken that was in it. It was much thinner than a Chik Fil A patty. The chicken was tasty so I would do a leg or breast the next time I visit if I do again. The fries were good but standard at best.   After leaving here, I felt underwhelmed. I feel it was overpriced and under portioned.

ifgYpe6LhXn0YFJNnnq7VQ.text: Perfectly fried, seasoned, great condiment options...and right on the strip until 2 AM!  I ordered the $11.25 (2) tender combo with crinkle fried and coleslaw. The Hubs got the $12.25 dark combo with the thigh and drum. The cashier must have heard us order two tender combos separately because I brought it back and they gave us a drum + thigh for free.  Condiments: wildflower honey, chipotle honey, wasabi honey, Texas Pete hot sauce, bbq sauce, and ketchup. The wildflower honey with a double dip into Pete was hot, sweet, savory...and what won the 5 stars to my heart. Definitely keeping them as a bookmark and will be coming back.  P.s. The sidewinder fries are an extra cost but I have to try those! They look like the perfectly crunchy film reel fries from Disney CA Adventure's Award Weiners!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauces
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Honeyyyyyy
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders and a comped thigh + drum since they boo booed the order. Happy mistake for us!

JB2MC2lwHUqvli4UuUBNZA.text: "I'm not mad, I'm disappointed."    I expected great things from this place. We ordered the Tender Supreme Combo (3 boneless chicken tenders with coleslaw and fries), a biscuit, smoked mac & cheese, and a Shakedown Street milkshake.   Chicken pieces were much larger than expected. Very juicy and well cooked.   We tried two of their specialty dipping sauces-- the wasabi honey and another honey-based one (obviously I wasn't a fan) were ok, but I would've like a honey mustard option.  They offered standard ketchup and bbq sauce too.   Biscuit was fine, nothing to write home about. Same with the crinkle-cut fries, mac & cheese and milkshake. Although the fries portion was plentiful.   BUT... they didn't give us the coleslaw AND didn't give us utensils!!  We got the order to go so didn't check our bag until we got back to our hotel. It occurred to me while we were getting dessert across the way that we may not have gotten forks so we stopped back in BRFC -- they said they were all out but we're expecting a delivery soon. Seriously? At 7:30 in the evening?!  The kind folks at Giordano's hooked us up with utensils.   Service-wise, the guy at the counter took our order and gave us our food. In between all that, he talked with the questionably dressed girl that ordered before us. I can't say he exuded friendliness or a willingness towards customer service. Which I'm fine with. I just wanted the food I ordered and a freakin' fork. Fail.

zuwkgzSA77CoMk9zNZhbag.text: Perfect chicken if you like fried chicken that's been pre deep-fried and been hanging out under the heating lamp for a good while. I lucked out the first time I came here because I got chicken pieces that were fresh out of the fryer. The seasoning is the bomb and the chicken was tender and juicy. But the more I visit her the worse it gets.  The season has always been good no matter what time of day or night you slide through Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken. That's one thing that this fried chicken excels at. On the downside, the Fried chicken here especially the chicken wings tastes like they've been hanging out under the heat lamp for hours. And when you do get those type of chicken, the meat is just dry. Drier than popeyes biscuits with any lack of juice of flavor in the meat and the only flavor you get is in the skin where Blue Ribbon employees drizzle their delicious seasoning.  For the dry dessert chicken, you get from this spot they do charge you a lot. Don't think I'd be stopping by here anymore to test my luck.

v4l_piudXrKiLv71Kr3rEQ.text: A friend and I tried Blue Ribbon late one night in Vegas, and it was DELICIOUS. We went back the next day, and it was still just as delicious. Blue Ribbon is conveniently located on the strip. The smell will entice you after a night of partying or just a day of sightseeing. Pictures don't do it justice, but the chicken was hot, fresh, and wonderfully seasoned. For me, there was no need for any sauces, but they do offer a few sauces including a chipotle honey and then your classic hot sauce. My friend's order came out later than mine did and they compensated her with a free drink and an extra piece of chicken. The food is pretty overpriced, but what isn't in Vegas? I got 2 legs and a wing, no fries or a drink, and it was $10. When you're on the strip and get a whiff of delicious fried chicken, you should remember to stop by Blue Ribbon!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 legs and a wing ($10)

B5Z1I-X9WbGTicSPDn8RmA.text: So I came here before attending an event at Flamingo around 11:30am , the pictures were convincing although the reviews were mixed.   One can literally smell the fried chicken while walking up to his place, it's a tiny restaurant, but with big flavor. The recipe for the breading on the chicken is delicious. I opted not to go for the spicy 5th time period it's hot enough outside, lol.   Upon entry I was greeted by the amazing staff here, they all have positive dispositions and even engaged in a little small talk with me before placing my order of chicken breast and mac and cheese.  My food was delicious and arrived quickly. The juiciness of the chicken is . When you couple that with the perfect breading to coat....well you've got a Blue Ribbon Winner !   When I arrived it was empty but when I left it was packed.  There is communal style seating, a few long tables so you can make the friend while you eat, lol.  Pricing was ok for the strip, my total came up to 12.13 for 2 items.   The last thing I'd like to point out is the amazing music choices. They play a mix of hip hop, R&B, oldies,and general feel good music! It made me feel at home . It REALLY makes the ambiance.  08/01/2019

awklrs3jLeEVS21y67a8Pw.text: In the pursuit of finding out who has the best fried chicken in Las Vegas, I made my way onto the Strip to check out renowned Blue Ribbon. Had I not already had one of Las Vegas' best fried chickens that morning, I may have not been so critical. Taking this into consideration, I'm erring on the side of generosity in my rating. Service was slow considering chicken is visibly sitting under warming lamps in the kitchen. Chicken was crisp and juicy and had an overwhelming flavor of paprika, which isn't bad, just noticeable. We could also detect a slight burnt flavor. Biscuits are horrible and offensive at $1.75 each.   Overall, chicken is good but not good enough for a local to bother navigating the Strip for or to pay its exorbitant prices.
