Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U4jWvcGmt4eZWA7wQDA1HQ.text: So the Las Vegas strip is deceivingly long and the walk from Excalibur to Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken when one is unprepared, may or may not put one in a really bad mood. Well, this happened to me the first time my husband wanted to venture to Blue Ribbon. All I remember is the walk and pain and agony in the summer heat. Ok, enough about my saga. Fast forward to the last couple of times we've been back ... this place has been the #1 place I've wanted to go!  They have a very simple menu here with fried chicken, bone in or tenders served with fries and a variety of honey dipping sauces. I like their Tenders Supreme meal (3 boneless tenders) which is a large size, comes with a lot of food. If you're in the mood to splurge, get the hot biscuit too. So good.  Overall, quick and tasty fried chicken spot. Minus one star only because the prices are a bit high. I'm sure we'll be back the next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tenders Supreme (3 tenders with fries &amp; coleslaw).

RgsUG4FT_7dnscvziVjolw.text: My friend ordered some to go from Blue Ribbon for me to try this past Saturday. It was freaking delicious. I love how crisp and juicy the skin is. It goes so well with the hot sauce.   The thighs were my favorite, because they're so moist and juicy. My friend and I devoured the 6 whole wings combo in minutes. It was THAT good. This is probably my new go to spot for a quick lunch bite every time I visit Vegas.

TdKNIVb2s-CeQPT9VJgiBA.text: Oof this was our last meal in Vegas, and it was a bad note to end on. We decided to go based on Yelp reviews and upon entering the (small) restaurant, everything looked promising. I could see the golden brown pieces of chicken, and everyone looked like they were enjoying the food. We ordered the two piece dark that came with fries and coleslaw and also ordered a buttered biscuit.   The food came out really quickly which was nice. Fries and coleslaw were standard and good, and the biscuit was flaky and buttery. The chicken had a spiced crust that deceived me into thinking the chicken would be flavorful. I bit into it though and the chicken was soooooo bland. So so bland. My boyfriend was actually convinced that they may have just cooked a bad batch and forgotten to season the meat but either way, bad news for a place that only does fried chicken. Meat was juicy and the skin was crunchy but I just needed salt and pepper and the people next to us must have agreed because they put hot sauce on every bite.  Prices are also kinda high so I'd say skip and go to Popeyes

_f6nx6qBIf2aWWVH3-2Mrw.text: I knew this place existed for a while.  But I never manage to cross the street to Bally's.  Today I made it a point to go.  Definitely not disappointed.  Ordered the 2 piece dark chicken and added a wing. It was supposed to have cole slaw... but I didn't get it. But I also didn't notice until after the fact.  So... down 1 star for that miss.  Chicken took some time to get out, which I expected for freshly cooked fried chicken.  The crisp was perfect as was the spice.  Dip it in the hot sauce, and it's even better.    I'd definitely come back...  and double-check my order next time.

The taste of their food is just average, chicken is dry, pricewise is on the expensive side eg. we ordered the 4 full wing combo (w/ fries and coleslaw) for $17, and drinks is not included, you have to buy it separately. 2pw76bQDYziJh6mn3oYWcQ.text: I finally made it in to BRFC's Strip location- out of necessity, because I am in love with the Love Bird! February's annual specialty sandwich, piled high with sweet potato fries and truffle sauce, is my favorite of their featured sandos. Staff at this location are friendly and attentive to detail, my sandwich was perfectly photogenic and easily the size of my head.   This location is in the Bally's Grand Bazaar Shoppes area, convenient to the escalators and elevators. I especially like that they have outdoor seating available. Sauces aplenty here, thankfully- as much as I like the monthly sandwiches they come up with, I'll be the first to admit that the toppings and sauces they add amp up the flavor. The chicken itself is not especially flavorful to me, though it is moist and has a visibly seasoned crust. I stick exclusively to the monthly sandwiches and the mac & cheese.  I am saddened that the closure of their Downtown Summerlin location has made me a less frequent visitor, but if you hustle from the parking garage and don't get distracted, you can get in and out in under an hour and avoid a $9 parking fee.

WQNlcJuSC3PzxDmMP4MXmA.text: This would be 3.5 stars if available.  I have had Blue Ribbon fried chicken at their NYC stand-alone shop, at their NYC sushi restaurant and at their Cosmopolitan Las Vegas location.  Blue Ribbon has always been what I was looking forward to --- until this trip.  This location is on the Las Vegas strip in the Grand Bazaar shops across from the Bellagio and next to The Cromwell.  It's a smaller venue with some outdoor seating as well.    It is counter service, and the staff was very friendly.  The menu is chicken, chicken, chicken --- and fried at that.    I ordered 3 whole wings and a thigh ala carte.  Maybe it was just a bad batch, but it was just off from the expectations of my several other Blue Ribbon chicken experiences.  The breading was almost too thick on the thigh, and a touch burned even.  The wings were okay, but seemed a bit odd as well.  The sauce station was a bit of a mess.  A broken wasabi honey dispenser made a mess and it was sticky as heck. That's understandable, but they probably need some constant upkeep at the sauce station.  The sauces are awesome though and the combo of the wasabi honey and Crystal hot sauce on the chicken is amazing.    I'm not giving up on BRFC, but this visit was a bit of a letdown -- next time will be better.

MixQdE3Hffe7wU5V5KgjXw.text: Ever since this opened, I have made it a point to eat here when I'm in town. It is SO GOOD!!! Lately we have been saying "if you went to Vegas and didn't get blue ribbon, did you even go to Vegas??"   Over the years, it has changed a bit (for example their selection of honey is a little more limited now).   I have ordered almost everything off the menu from here at least once but my favorites are still the sandwiches. However last time I was here (April 2019) I was a little disappointed because the man at the counter said they weren't making sandwiches anymore because they were having trouble with their distributor (WTF?!) and half their menu was like blacked out...  Anyway the service has always been high quality. They are nice, friendly, make conversation and answer any questions you may have.

Ideal for blowing that left over pocket cash when you stumble drunk out of the casino. Wait, too personal! Just kidding. This place hit the spot, but did I mention the salt? It's salty.

_OQu411hgrXY1TyAyG3ctg.text: Came here with some pretty high expectations...  The chicken fingers were okay, a lot of seasoning which didn't help the overall taste .. would compare to Raising Canes without there sauce! The ranch containers were filled 1/4 of the way and when we asked for more because 2 1/4 filled ramekins are not enough for 12 tenders and fries. The fries were okay. You really can't mess fries up. That's why I'm giving them 3 stars  Based on me having to pay 59$ for 12 chicken tenders and fries and two drinks ... extremely disappointed. Will not be returning or recommending

DX7D45HcZAydk77ai5NIiQ.text: This place knows how to cook their fried chicken! I ordered a kale salad with fried chicken and was really surprised on how the chicken was perfectly moist! Y_DRp3cb-DGBETOdAErFkA.text: Wasn't hungry but this place was on my Vegas Food List so I stepped in and ordered a breast as a snack. OMGITWASAWESOME! My girl ordered the Mac n Cheese and she too was very impressed. I saw this guy and I wasn't sure if he was Flosstradamus (my current favorite DJ). He ordered chickens to-go and wanted the sauce hook ups. I should have asked if he was indeed Floss. We are here all week so I will visit BRFC-GB most def. Oh people here were very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I5bBH1w-xGnPEjxXmBI8Iw.text: Very thick breading, juicy and tasty chicken. Fries also noteworthy (small, thin slices; crunchy).  Pleasant staff.

8_sMYrjJBnEgSyR0LuWnhw.text: YES. Blue ribbon is such a gem located right on the strip in front of Bally's. The chicken is so good. They also have so many sauces out which is always important. 10/10

jSAyl1WtvAxpabypzm-uvA.text: The best fried chicken in the world. Very friendly staff and love how they have a bar you can sit at while waiting for your food and grab a big beer!!! Their batter is amazing!!

stLEo3WrrDMxITBNofrUgw.text: The Firebird is as good as always. I dont think i will ever order anything else because its that damn good. Also, workers are friendly as usual and i like how they have filled cups of water at the counter.

gf52aREMr7kGf6fzGMxsRg.text: BOMB BOMB BOMB  Servers are extremely friendly and knowledgeable. Chicken is crispy and juicy.  Mac and cheese is on point.  Only negative is their soda was a bit flat.   Will be coming back again!

lq7VBh5MZ-umkt0iismikQ.text: Beware! There's no chicken sandwiches. Made a point to visit BRFC before heading out of town only to be told they don't serve sandwiches. So much for taking part in what everyone is raving about..

41xYmxvbH5EAj-bdu4Tymw.text: First time ive been back since theyve changed it from a japanese fusion restaurant. The raw oysters and clams were delicious. Sweet and tasted like new england. Carpaccio was ok. The lamb was excellent. Medium rare in the center with that nice gamey taste. The pigeon was also really good. The last time i had pigeon it was in china and it was really oily and the pigeon looked like it was flexing like Arnold Schwarzenegger. But this one reminded me of quail and tasted really good. I wonder where they get their pigeons from...

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb and pigeon

2gyxPB9EdB9OgqmrhkffjQ.text: This spot is located in that front-of-the-ballys shopping and eating area.  Went on a quieter Monday evening, and we still had a very fresh, fried, crispy, juicy, moist(yes,MOIST), and tasty signature sandwich. The bread was perfectly chewy and crispy at the same time, the chicken was accompanied by sassy pickles and some fresh cabbage(..?)  The meal isn't done there... The wholesome sandwich is accompanied by a slew of honey based sauces to go with my sandwich (or your other chicken based orders) Wasabi honey, Chipotle honey and brbbq sauce is just to name a few. ANYONE you know who likes chicken with honey or Tang or both. You need to come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sauces
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Original chicken sandwich, don&#39;t need anything more

JWu7a_kGHGqWf1xJFklrgg.text: Between a 3 and a 4 but service was good so I'll give it a 4.  I would recommend the chicken wings. The "fries all the way" were a bit too much for me. They also sell alcohol. I got a small can of sangria and it was a bit pricey ($10). You might as well go to CVS right next door!  If you want greasy food, definitely stop by here.

7UmR2lzDOf-llgQrtuUZqw.text: Oh my gosh, this place is so good. I am now back home in Missouri and I am seriously craving some Blue Ribbon chicken. So fresh, so hot and tasty.  I cant wait to go back.

_zwzFjPmv1O3BK09u8MPcA.text: Vegas Baby! This IS the best fried chicken that I have ever had in my life. Blue Ribbon fried chicken at the Grand Bazzaar shops in front of ballys.  Never had chicken so crispy yet with such hot and JUICY  meat. Even the breast meat was juicy. The seasoning on the skin is just perfect and the sauces on the table take this to the next level ! Chipotle honey, bbq, wasabi honey, wildflower honey, hot sauce and habanero house hot made sauce.  EAT HERE and get the 4 piece mix with fired and slaw.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

51csh0rNklk5LkZqXMMr6A.text: Stopped here on the way back from a pool party! I had heard of this place and was in the mood for a chicken sandwich so I decided to give it a shot.  I ordered the firebird with fries. The fries were good nothing spectacular. I really enjoyed the chicken sandwich and it was very filling! This isn't your typical chick fil a sandwich...you're gonna need 2 hands to eat this bad boy!   I would absolutely stop by again next time I'm in town! It's quick, filling and delicious!

brBSYvSHtkrJHT3xyS8gKg.text: Yummy yummy! After seeing countless posts on Instagram about this place, we decided to stop in! Hungover and hungry, we were so glad there wasn't a line on Thu afternoon. We tried the original sandwich and the firebird - both were delicious! Firebird has a little kick to it. Their fried are so good! String fries that are crispy have a special place in my heart!

Ar8-KOjT7itHCTNxjmFncA.text: Expensive due to location but this place rocks. It has the most satisfying cost to taste ratio anywhere near Bally's. If you don't explore the sauces, you are hurting yourself. KFC ain't close. LV Lemonade with and extra shot is the way to go. We had a lovely guide, Marzella. She is a supervisor and knows what to consume with zeal. Try the house-made hot sauces and mix them up. This place is my new hangover haven. Although the price point is high, consider that most places charge too much on the strip. Get the tenders and add extra tenders, explore sauces and drinks. You'll be full and happy.

gqW9ZiHljgeCfvR_hfnEtg.text: Fast service. Plenty of seating at 3pm on a Sunday Got The Pit, no bacon, added Spicy Chipotle Mayo, side fries and a root beer. It did NOT disappoint.  My lady had the The Fire Bird, the pickled poblano peppers were a fantastic addition. Her side of smoked mac and cheese was on point.  And they give you variety of sauces and HONEYS.  Yes, honeys.

6aJ10DW8Ti4mroFiQ9STAA.text: Not sure they are world famous yet, but if they keep expanding, they will be!    You can't go wrong here - great location and the staff is super friendly with great service.  The food is reasonably priced, even in a location where you would expect it to be over the top.    Succulent, juicy and flavorful the chicken is excellent.  I suggest staying with the actual chicken pieces instead of the tenders, they had better texture and realistically, the same amount of meat.  The combos come with fries and slaw, but you can sub double fries for the slaw - which I snuggest you do as they are perfectly crispy, crunch and delicious while the slaw is a bit bland.  They have multiple sauces available, be sure to try out the spicy honey.

dD8yyqOBzN5J6asJj8qNDA.text: Locals tend to stir away from the strip except for special events or shows... I'm not one of them. So, as someone that loves the chaos of the LV Blvd, it is frustrating to go some of the strip area restaurants only to be disappointed that quality and taste is not high priority... I'm guessing, gearing towards tourist and not for repeat customers. BLUE RIBBON FRIED CHICKEN is not one of those overpriced and underwhelming tourist trap. This fast casual place is not only, over the top with customer service, the atmosphere is modern and comfortable and the food is absolutely delicious at affordably prices. We have had the whole pieces of fried chicken and the chicken strips. Both, are equally as good. The fries are addictive. Looking forward to trying the mac n cheese on our next visit. I can't stress enough, how this place really is worth the wait. They also have adult spirits which is a nice plus! By far, the BEST Blood Mary I have had since being in Vegas. YES, for real! Listen, the Grand Bazaar area is full of tourist trap restaurants... trust me, I been to them all. This really is the only one worth the walk.

pCXP93yP9SFCHM6-4PgghQ.text: We happened upon this great restaurant. The staff was very professional and knowledgeable. Our food was fresh and delicious. We collectively had wings, Cole slaw, Mac n cheese and sweet potato fries. Glad that were were able to experience such goodness!

bdwn7ZpcHrG0ao14skoN-A.text: Great place! The chicken has great flavor, it's a little hidden gem  you won't regret going and the price are not to bad either

VeZ_Zn4zSzcdF-1dpbUEtA.text: Love the fried chicken here and I've been here twice. My favorite is the thighs which you can order individually if you don't want the combo. They have a combo that includes hearts and gizzards as well as a plate of chicken lovers with onions. I plan on trying those next time.

CTdMa3PF50z-K9pq-UKFbw.text: By far one of hands down best chicken sandwiches (chicken period for that matter) I have ever had in my entire life. The prices here are extremely generous for the quality of food they serve. Seating is limited however we went during lunch time during the week and had no issue getting a table outside in the cool breeze. Employees were very friendly/welcoming. Do yourself a favor and grab a Firebird sandwich to jump start your metabolism for all the alcohol consumption you will be doing.

9lqrTLgegFf1ARmBFjBMLA.text: A lot of hype and of course being in Vegas u gotta try anything and everything and since I love me some fried chicken wanted to give this place a shot... after much Day drinking wanted something a little more hearty so I ordered the Bird which is a family meal style 2 breast 2 thighs 2 wings side of fried and coleslaw..40.00 is a little steep but why do u expect in Vegas on the strip... I've never been a fan of deep fried chicken breast since I've always just eaten dark meat... my past experience with fried chicken at hundreds of places have always been very disappointing... This place was exactly the opposite lol the chicken breast was perfectly crispy fried and moist the thighs and wings were actually dry to my taste but over all had good seasoning the slaw was good not sweet and of course the string fries were string fries I did however enjoy the variation of sauces they provided a wasabis honey... spicy bbq and honey bbq of of course fried chicken is always hella good with just plain hot sauce... our friend ordered the fire bird sandwich which looked amazing but he stated the sandwich the chicken was pretty dry...

Fcc5p-YbGUZsilLDznUBDw.text: Located outside of Bally's.  Good, freshly fried chicken.  So good and open until 2:00am to help satisfy late-night cravings.  Crispy crunchy on outside and moist and tender on the inside.  Seating is limited inside, but there are tables with umbrella covers outside.  Or you can have it to go.  The fries are thinly cut and irresistible.  They offer a few sauces to go with the meal.

dRCQciuxpMkWoyQgM9advA.text: Best chicken sandwich I've had... best chicken wings I've ever had this place is the bomb!!!

3TO-KeyuinuFeeihuptrBg.text: This place is definitely not the best chicken on the strip. We ordered chicken strips and fries... the chicken was hard / over cooked and the breading was soft and mushy. The fries are great and crispy. The bbq sauce and honey chipotle sauce are on point.

9fp3P1MpCTSbAUW321s6aw.text: This place is the bomb !! Stayed in Vegas and hit the spot up twice before i left had to come back for more . Everything is made fresh and the employees there are extra nice ! Loved the chicken , although i would pass on the wings next time they are small lol the 2 piece leg combo is where it's at and it's worth it !

5o1K2fWvApDmuU_gVndAcA.text: Went on a whim and went to Blue Ribbon after a night out, and it was the best decision we have ever made! The special sauce is amazing, as well as the smoked mac n cheese. The service was fast, and the employees were friendly. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone walking down the strip!

abyX-V0HRGOlReHfyZZkqw.text: Passed by Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken while we were exiting Bally's (next to Starbucks), and made a mental note to try one day.   We passed by again, and ordered The Drumline ($9.95 2 drumstick combo) and The Wingman ($7.95 2 wing combo). All combos come with side of fries and cole slaw. Chicken was well seasoned and crispy, but the chicken to fries ratio is unbalanced. If you're actually hungry, you'll definitely need to order more chicken or try a sandwich. Love their skinny fries and slaw.  They had a good selection of sauces for your chicken, but the bbq was my favorite.   I'd definitely want to try their main restaurant at the Cosmo next time.

5EP_o8cBoN_eDvA90g5RoA.text: Went for a quick stop yesterday. I grabbed a drumstick and smoked Mac and cheese! Both were great but the reason I cared to write a review was because of the Mac and cheese. My husband is a Mac and cheese lover and this one really stood out. It has smoked cheese in it which really elevated it. It was also a great price for a quick snack. Highly recommended

IlLFKe6fvqDoG_3-XTluBg.text: Located in the rear of the Grand Bazaar outdoor shopping area on the Strip outside of Bally's.  Order at the counter.  We got the dark meat pieces with fries and slaw.  It was very good.  Service was fine, but no refills on soda.  I tried all of the sauces on the counter on my fried chicken.  Honey and fried chicken is a good combo.

v7Dt8vyv7yf4Nb_8GtbQdQ.text: uhh-mazing. Chicken, fries and drinks were great. Ate here twice in one day. Love me some good yard bird.

OKr5a25loWkqkuspuo4X_w.text: Got the whole Bird and chicken liver. Tasted good but I felt both were overcooked, especially the livers. The crust on the chicken was nice and crispy but parts were borderline black. And prepare to pay.

q1NLY-8IJWq0SVwVUmS0Pg.text: Best chicken sandwich in the history of chicken sandwiches. Chick-Fil-A can go piss up a rope. This place is where it's at.

--qtVrJgy4t_xwbNu5IIhA.text: Great food!! Extremely TERRIBLE service!! Staff appeared dirty and poorly taken care of, moved extremely SLOW but seemed to make time to play around in the kitchen presenting themselves in a very unprofessional manner, i even seen one of the girls put a chicken tender in her MOUTH! Chewing like a camel while plating food . All in all we had to wait a total of 30 Minutes for them to put 3 chicken tenders and fries on a plate (it wasn't busy at all, we checked on the order twice, and it was actually supposed to be 4 chicken tenders because we ordered and extra but still received only 3). This location should strongly consider NEW STAFF a "NOW HIRING" sign is much needed.

Kyk_R0ZEEIl-Jgdd68nzug.text: I regret we ordered chicken here today.. We had enough of buffet the last couple of days.. and since today is our last day in Vegas we just wanted a quick bite for lunch before heading to the airport.. The price is too expensive 6pcs chicken is 22bucks.. for me thats ok it must be good for the price.. We order to go coz our plan is to go at Bally's food court where we can grab rice .. good thing We did! why? the chicken is TOO SALTY!!! salty on its breading but when you eat the inside part of it? Its TASTELESS!!! OMG.. You cannot even compare the price and Taste of POPOYES Chicken or even KFC.. Totally Ripoff

M93it-iI9Fh49T2W4kWJ9g.text: I have been there a couple times and always sit outside at the little bar, Tiffany the bartender is so much fun to talk with, her service is excellent and such a pretty girl, they have lots of yummy alcohol beverages at the window(Milkshakes!!) I will be going back, can't wait till the weather is nicer, at night this is a cool place to sit and have a snack and a alcoholic beverage!

5NDvvE8AHKyPRDdAEV5gdg.text: The chicken was very good it was my first time having it was so good came back the next day next time I come to Vegas I will definitely be here again I recommend this place to anyone that loves chicken

D5jN1D-l8yI5fJ81cKSA_Q.text: The service was "hotter" than the room temperature chicken. I was looking for great chicken like I had a Lolo's...It just didn't taste like homemade fried chicken!

G3oKxMNGt2-W4SLmqIAAoQ.text: I was staying at the Bally's and every time I left the casino, I was blessed with the smell of this fried chicken. Staff was super friendly, very clean place, DELICIOUS chicken (seasoned perfectly!)

C1A5ousUylYdj_AjaDU_2A.text: I have been a number of times and the service has never been outstanding, but today took the cake!  It took me 18 minutes to get my food.  and all 6 of the people that came in after me got there food before i did.  My fries sat on the counter for well over 5 minutes and were ice cold. The sandwich was mediocre at best and also not particularly warm.  I can deal with so so service if the food is good.  But the food day was far from good and the service was horrible.  I doubt I will return to this location which is a shame as it is walking distance from my work.

QYzILgBEz60skfJ54t3kag.text: Stopped off at the Blue Ribbon during my short stay at the Cosmopolitan. I was pleasantly surprised with this new restaurant, it did not disappoint! My husband ordered the fried chicken, that came with mashed potatoes- delish!! I couldn't choose, everything looked amazing so I opted for the Pu Pu platter. It included one of each item: buffalo chicken wing, rib, fried oyster (wasn't too crazy about this one), duck egg roll and chicken on a stick. Spoiler, it came out with this really cool sterno thingy where you can cook the ribs to your liking. Really, really cool! Highly recommend this place, staff was awesome and food was delish. We will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4vvswTyPIj2nF-wMxi60Ww.text: Their chicken is always fresh, and they get it out so quick. It's always juicy and hot, so is all of their sides they serve. The customer service is always amazing too.

4K4cELcw5ArTD8P_p5pSIQ.text: Amazing chicken! Amazing shoe string fries! Everything was so flavorful. The line moved quickly. There are lots of sauces and honey to put on your chicken. There are options of sandwiches and various pieces of chicken to choose from. Sides, milkshakes (alcoholic and non). Great customer service. Overall had a delicious meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CX8VRVRK_5QOAavdfYyzYQ.text: Great flavor! A little pricey, but everything on the strip is expensive FYI.... The chicken had tons of flavor packed into each bite! I didn't want the experience to end. The fries were good too. I like their sauce selection. All of their sauces have a honey base, delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2pc White $12.55 (Vegas Strip prices)

uafmDZjSd1p_QVSnE7po9A.text: If I could you guys -5 stars I would. The chicken wings had no taste and the fries were salt as fuck . Hot fries were on top but as I started to eat more there were old cold fries at the middle and bottom.  I wouldn't recommend my dog visiting this place. The workers were inattentive and seem to not care about the customers. Everything in Vegas is expensive but it doesn't mean it's good. This place is a prime example

t98BjyZRmi-YPdbw9ngaWQ.text: The chicken is good, well seasoned and very flavorful and crispy skin. Do not like the fries (too skinny for me, you have to pick up and eat a handful to taste them). The cole slaw was not very good at all.   This particular location is located in an absolutely horrible location. The seating inside this place is a 1. Terrible, terrible seating plan (literally no tables) just bar type seating.  Not comfortable at all. We will not return to this location. We would not recommend this location to anyone nor will be take any friends or family there.

1cP0KmRG-NpX6wQ0ItLGVg.text: The chicken is good, but I think Popeyes is better. Not the best chicken but I was satisfied, I preferred the shoe string fries with the works over the chicken itself. The fries are tasty when you're craving something that's filling. I did like the honey options which were sweet and unique.

sRyPDKgBOrhz77dgATDDfg.text: Good for late night eats, but chicken is just ok. I wasn't blown away, but it was late and I was hungry so it was good for what it was.

TcY5bBiuMcTfvOwM9j6thQ.text: Pretty standard fried chicken place. It's a small shop located at the bazaar outside of Bally's. Prices were really reasonable considering the location. A sandwich will run you about $9 (no sides included). I ordered the blue cheese bacon and red onion chicken sandwich. I enjoyed it. The orange habanero sauce on the table was good, I dipped everything in it. I also got the livers and onions. Nothing was too greasy or overly fried.  I recommend it if you like fried chicken.

k3g9pCb8ewZBv93cN_evBw.text: Great taste of home cooked fried chicken. These guys do it right! The chicken is spiced perfectly. If you like crunchy fries, you'll love this place.

fC6Nm51egpg8OD6faxlm5Q.text: Blue Ribbon is located in the Grand Bazaar just steps outside of Bally's.  First off, they are open until 2am for the late night eats.  I went at a more respectable time of 2pm I think... you know, you lose track of time in Vegas!  Anyways, casual eatery for all things chicken.  I was surprised to learn that the chicken is not coated in thick breading/batter.  If you want that, then you will be disappointed.  It is covered in a very thin coating of spices, yet the chicken tenders remained juicy and flavorful.  The fries with seasoning were awesome.  Coleslaw was aight... nothing too special about it.  I sat next to one of the sauce caddies, so I was able to taste test with all the sauces.  I didn't have a stand out favorite sauce, but it was fun to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carousel of sauce.
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 boneless tender combo with fries and coleslaw.

pHDG7MJ-p5M8A9uO9NDmqA.text: Blue Ribbons fried chicken has a pedigree to its sandwich but personally is hard to rate. If you don't mind paying extra for fast food than you're loving this spot. For two crispy sandwich meals it came out to $30. I felt that was kind of steep.The sandwiches were good but idk if it's a must have. It's more of an alternative goto.   I would give it a 3 1/2 stars

YLyRVEudcep3mmwOlrTUOQ.text: Their fried chicken is really good . A little pricey but worth it. We will definitely recommend this place.

EGkJKTnKW5dMcWivZZvSMg.text: Way Over priced. 2 strips. Fries and a soda for $18. Crazy. The soda was really good. The chicken was more like a light snack. Fries were tiny and cold.

Oq_OAdhPRn_UKo74CwY86w.text: Forgot to take picture. Can't wait to finish them! Very delicious Fried chicken and French fries.  Recommend to add one dollar for the cheese on your fries, worth every penny.

Nk_TGsMEnao4C5_UdxwPyQ.text: Okay let's begin by walking in your hit with a smell of grease. Okay what to be expected your in a fried chicken place. Look over the menu decided what we wanted. Came to the counter to order I ask the young lady can I sub the sides with a side salad I get I short no. Okay how about mac and cheese. I get a No! All you can get is more fries! Well okay then I'll get more fries. My boyfriend ask about what types of cheese they have. She gives him the well what sandwich. He tells her the blue ribbon. She says it doesn't come with cheese. Okay so we can't pay to have cheese added.?. We ordered waited about 8 min for already cooked sitting under a heat lamp food. And his sandwich was made wrong. He returned it about 5 min in he got up to ask about it and they forgot. For this service and quality of food you will probably get a nicer  server and fresh food at a popeyes.

RgZ4kYruK8l9FI5pFdDQJQ.text: This place is pretty legit! Me and the lady stopped her for lunch. We both got chicken sandwiches and shared a large loaded fry. Everything was delicious. The sauces they have on the tables are amazing and acompany the crispy fried chicken so well.  The only issue here are the prices. Two sandwiches and a large order of fries shouldn't cost over $35, even if it is on the strip. I believe the fries alone we're $14.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IvzS73Q5jxeWe_rDMxnjmw.text: revision: this location doesn't sell sandwiches nor sweet potato fries. Ugh I hate when I find a place and the things I liked they remove or change. I have ordered the chicken tenders with the advisement of the cashier tater tots in Lue of fries. Itll probably taste good I'm just annoyed I cant get what I usually get. This is my last time trying them

CTazmvx4_sOxinTKfV8YWg.text: I would give them a 3.5 rating. The employees were really nice. The chicken does need a bit more salt. The biscuits were a nice touch. The butter melted right over them. You can only substitute the coleslaw (who eats that?) for pickles. The pickles were great. Didn't get a picture before I started eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Royal wing meal biscuits and pickles.

-UrKnQqhMUid563CKucjbQ.text: This was one of the best hangover/hair-of-the-dog meals I had this round in Vegas. I mean, it's greasy delicious fried chicken for God's sake! The sauces, chicken, fries, and side are all awesome. Plus you can get some beers to wash everything down. This was a fun/satisfying place to start the day after an intense night. Good people watching.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 piece white combo, pickled cucumbers, and corn and bacon

h3G0E0QV_gYIHXwEaIyzWg.text: First timer!!! Just have to say the employees behind the counter here are amazing! They had smiles on there faces interacting with the guests, they definitely made our experience. We both got the tender meals. The chicken was good but the inside didn't really have a lot of flavor but it was still okay. The fries are amazing and make sure to get the blue ribbon sauce it's to die for!

RFGCLXCrJhlqEvS01bgzaA.text: Wow!  I'm a total chicken eater!  After a lousy start in the wannabe breakfast buffet, we figured we give this place a shot.    Now mind you we have reservations @ Seersucker! Oh it was hard to just walk by this place & not try.  Obviously we just skewed our reservation.  We each ended up having 3 wings a piece!  Should have stopped at 2.  The chicken batter is light & has a dash of that kind of Louisiana seasoning.   The French fries oh lord were so fresh & crunchy! There's a wide variety of ketchup sauces.  Never the less this place is awesome!  Great food & atmosphere.    Now I know what blue ribbon chicken taste like! No regrets, agh let me see about changing the dinner reservation.

Ym0UJI7tFT9mvOyNLVsAEQ.text: The service was good. That's about it. The chicken was tasteless. I had a chicken sandwich with BBQ and my partner got a sandwich with ranch. They were tight on the ranch and my sandwich was bland.

aHgGlZQDr4R-9y2P8vYyog.text: My boyfriend is still talking about the fried chicken he had here. It's a small restaurant. The serve alcohol and mainly just fried chicken, Sandwiches, and some sides. I had the double cheese sandwich that was good but I have had better. My boyfriend had the sandwich with the pineapple on it and he said it was very good but would of got more of the fried chicken instead. We definitely would go back and just order the fried chicken. It was the best. So delicious and the flavor was amazing. It also just fell off the bone it was cooked so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y-HHWAFOvXIDSKD5xosLOw.text: I ate here on 5/2/19. I love fried chicken but don't eat it too often because it's fried food. Well I was really excited to try this place but sadly I was very disappointed. The chicken was slightly salty and not a whole lot of flavor and not as crispy and the pieces were SO small. The drumstick was the size of a chicken wing drumstick. I ordered extra crispy sweet potato fries and it was as if a bottle of salt spilled on it. It was so so salty that I couldn't even eat it. It also wasn't fresh. It tasted as if it was from the day before. It wasn't crispy at all. Also the cole slaw was rancid and tasted spoiled. Everyone I was with complained about the saltiness of all of their fries and also said the chicken was mediocre. This is a small place with indoor and outdoor seats. I rated them a 3 star only because the service was good because their was also a guy who was cleaning up and picking up our trays and he was very nice. Also they do have very good lemonade. Otherwise I would of gave them a 2 star for the food. I will not be dining here ever again unless they improve the quality of their food.

qbRxylEElSsG28vDyLdNtQ.text: The people have spoken and it's True - the chicken is DA BOMB. Wow.   It's juicy Served piping hot Not alot of heavy think breading Breading is super flavorful on it's own Great selection of honey based sauces for dipping Lots of options to purchase by piece or combos  So good that I forced myself to eat another dinner just so I could confirm the goodness. Haha.   Fries are shoestring, which we liked.  Water station is set up in the corner for plenty of ice cold aqua.  They are open late. Yay! They open early. Yay!  Can't wait to come back.

cVeLUXOVJkaLbSCpn6srcw.text: I love fried chicken and been wanting to try this every time I'm in New York. This location is conveniently located below Bally's hotel. I got the two piece dark with fries. It usually comes with fries and coleslaw. The fries was thin, very crispy and flavorful. One of the best fries I've eaten. As for the chicken, the skin was crispy and tasty but the meat was a bit bland. I was surprised will the sauces available. Never thought honey based sauce would taste so good. My favorite was the chipotle honey.

LA_7pdtk1ck5vIRL65pJgQ.text: Soooooo Yummy!!!! Best Chicken in Vegas! The manager (I forget her name) was super friendly and patient when we came in right at closing time!  I highly recommend this place! Mac n cheese was also very good!

VQ76ySqG-DpOLSGQr_Dvdg.text: i literally just stopped by here while i was waiting for my friend to pick up giordianos across the way.  i decided to get some fried chicken too cause fried chicken and pizza, duh. its kinda expensive, i think we ordered 2 drumsticks, 2 thighs, and a breast with 2 cokes for $25?? something like that.   so this review is just based upon the chicken, didn't get to try the sides or anything.  maybe i have a unsophisticated palette but i didn't get the CRUNCH of fried chicken that i love.  the seasoning was good and the chicken was tender, but if im gonna eat fried chicken, i want some of that satisfying battery goodness. anyways, fun to try but wouldn't return.

kUcXuTAvzsN_lfSbkTRkrw.text: We got the Firebird burger, the cheesy supreme burger and drumsticks (drumline) with fries and coleslaw, I would highly recommend anyone visiting Vegas to eat here. Ths is one of the best chicken spots I've eaten at in USA. Their blue ribbon sauce adds an amazing flavour to the burgers that I would go back for again and again. Definitely do not skip this on a trip to Vegas for anyone who is a chicken lover!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Firebird burger, the cheesy supreme burger and drumsticks (drumline) with fries and coleslaw.

AWPpv8c0GSmg9qKxTBSA4g.text: Food was really good. The chicken sandwich was crispy and all white meat. Fries are shoestring like but good. Their soda is made with real sugar, it was awful. Stick to water or beer.

fvTm7yCJxqb6ODqfiMX99Q.text: I did want to love this place ! Have one word that brought my 5 star to 4 is location location location !! We had some chicken and the everything fries which were very tasty but staring at us from the window outside looked like a poor homeless woman.  And let's face it Bally's isn't the most appealing of hotels these days. It needs a revamp in a bad way.  We hiked here anticipating greatness but wasn't impressed .  If they moved their location I'm sure it would feel more welcoming .  I'm not going to say skip it because the food is pretty tasty , but I'll wait to try the original in New York !! I did review this one more time and decided to give it a 4 star because the consensus of our group is that the food was super good!!  And we didn't want people to miss out on the tasty goodness that this place had!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious fries!!!

JPH8TlLx0CTCyGOpxkoj4g.text: ???? I don't understand why the ratings are so high?? I usually don't even leave reviews but I was just so disappointed with this place I had to. I got the tenders and they were DRY oh my god I felt like I was eating an old boot. But the worst part is that even if the meat WASN'T dry, the flavor was soooo bland (and oddly metallic?) that it would still taste like sh*t. I've had better tenders from jack in the box at 4am. WAY better.  I don't know what the 4 and 5 star reviewers were eating but it wasn't whatever the hell I got!!

_YBtm5J3wYnEzX4VlX1H0w.text: I heard this was one good fried chicken spot from my folks in NYC. So while here in Vegas, I decided to give it a try. And it did not disappoint. Shoe string fries cooked the way I like them, crispy until the last fey; even with ketchup on it. Chicken was cooked well, succulent, juicy, crispy and flavorful. The hush puppies too were on point. Pieces of what looked like corn and carrots in them.  They have a variety of sweet sauces that go with everything. Over all, this was a great place, staff was very friendly too.

My favorite part of the meal was definitely the fries....they were super duper crispy and seasoned perfectly. I also had their cheeses supreme burger (i love cheese!!!!) and it was to die for. The fried chicken patty was crispy and juicy...... I definitely need another burger right now haha. If I ever come back to Vegas I will for sure stop by again and try their fried chicken wings.

Located in the Bazaar Shop "alley" across Bellagio, Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken is just one of many affordable eateries on the strip.

zH29cPZ-3mfSTA6XpFMXmw.text: The spice blend on the chicken is really tasty and the fries are thin and crispy. Kinda pricy but decent portion size. Good beer selection and great location on strip.

yD3hNfdjp0YCzkbYJY4jbg.text: Not worth the hype. Was expecting much more. Nothing about this place stood out to me. The works fries were way tooo salty and I felt like the wings had too much coating/batter or whatever they put on it. They have a nice variety of sauces but nothing that tickled my tastebuds.   My boyfriend got the blue ribbon sandwich and he said the seasoning was too over powering. However, he said the chicken was nice and thick. It has your typical veggies and the bread was fluffy and sort of sweet.   Their habanero sauce was the best one out of the 5 or 6 that they have. They also have milkshakes that I wanted to try along with the alcoholic ones! This joint also closes at 2am on some days which might be good for those late night munchies.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YH-G39ETHG5K-CeZbL81mw.text: Darn, I really wanted to like this place! Although I was pretty hungover, I was expecting some yummy fried chicken to bring me back to life. Unfortunately, all I got was a half an hour wait (while the rest of my party and numerous other patrons received their food before I did) for some super dry and inedible chicken strips.   Despite this hiccup, the staff was very friendly and even gave me a complimentary soda for waiting so long. My friend really liked the chicken wing and leg, but for me, the flavor of the chicken was really good, just the meat was too dry. The sides, however, really stole the show. The smoked mac n' cheese? Mmmm, tasted like smoked Gouda heaven. And the pickled cucumbers and coleslaw? Tangy, crunchy deliciousness.   They keep it nice an air conditioned inside and their sauce selection is great too! I would definitely come back once I come to Vegas again but would try a different cut of meat.

HPCrwr92JJ7RsloC48ZZdA.text: The fried chicken is perfectly seasoned for my taste buds. Crunchy on the outside soft on the inside.  The coleslaw tastes fresh and not to sour.  The fries kinda tasted stale to me, tasted like it was cooked in old oil. Just stick to the chicken.  The reason the 4 star is because of the service. The girl server seemed like she did not want to be there and as soon she took out order. She stepped aside and flirted with a gentleman that came in.   I would've given a 5 star for the food. But I also counted the service I received.

1TIXiq7SJcojdnHRf5Ps8g.text: Such a great place to get delicious fried chicken and fries! My two favorite food!   Their style of fried chicken is deliciously seasoned and fried to perfection. It's crispy, golden brown, and moist, like how fried chicken should be. Their fries are thin, battered and crispy. The food goes so well with each other and it's the best comfort food you can get on the strip!  Try the chicken and fries with their honey sauces: wasabi or wildflower. Both honey are good, even the wasabi one was delicious (that's coming from someone who hates wasabi!)  This location is in the Grand Bazaar at Bally's, which is a new development of modern restaurants and shops that are open late. We came here around midnight and they were still open and happy to serve customers.   Apparently this brand is famous in NYC and Vegas, but being from California this is the first time we tried it since we were in Vegas during NYE weekend.  When I come back to Vegas, I'll hit this place up again and try other combos on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try the barbecue sauce, ketchup and coke slaw. So good
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s like an upscale and hipsterfied Chick-fil-A ! So delicious

P1AjkyT_apdnag5TECf6oA.text: Best fried chicken on the strip period. We had a two piece Brest and wing and an order of tenders. The fries and the chicken were great crunchy good flavor and juicy meats. The hard beverages ,ice tea and lemonade were ok. But expensive and not strong I guess you go for the chicken not the bar.   I'd go back for the chicken !!

ktDFw7DE3ICWyfEe4TqOpg.text: 3.5 stars. This place has an amazing strawberry mojito. I was a big fan. 4 stars from me for that drink. My boyfriend is the one that ordered the food - a two piece dark and a full wing with fries and slaw. My bf got a few sauces to try, but wasn't a fan of any of them; he liked the chicken better plain. I wasn't personally a fan of the chicken, but that's more his thing than mine. The fries tasted like McD's fries to me and I wasn't a fan of the coleslaw at all. Like I said - I was just here to drink, so I'm trying to merge my review of the mojito and his review of the chicken to be fair.

Limnrly4cb_LmfrFdyGSzA.text: had this bookmarked for my next vegas trip and well it did not disappoint! super crispy and juicy!!!  the workers were nice but the food took way too long. few customers but not super busy (1:15 am). the sodas taste weird here too lol.   ill come back.

ZqgwtdoFa4jZbT51uO6cWw.text: The fried chicken here was really good and so was the Mac and cheese. There was few minute wait but the chicken was fresh, crispy and hot. If in Vegas again and craving affordable fried chicken, I'd stop by again. Good food, nothing special.

MThuxMVijTGjUfk6ZpP2hA.text: If you want some fried chicken and beer in Vegas come here! It was my first time trying this place and it will not be my last! The food is so good and the staff were really nice. We got the blue ribbon sandwich, hush puppies, and mac n cheese. All were so good! The food did not take too long at all for them to make! I can't wait to come back.

I tried the chicken breast and tore pieces apart to try the different sauces, my fav was the chipotle honey. Will surely be back!!

_PtPn-Shwr3saZfXfMXRmw.text: BEST chicken I've ever had. Ate dinner here 2 nights in a row. Sad that there's not one where I live!

5eWoLZgHsNjYGxz5xNx2Sw.text: Pretty decent chicken sandwich! Not the best but it does the job. The wait was quick and it's open super late. For being in the middle of the strip it's really fairly priced! We got wings and the double cheese chicken sandwich. Both were good and hit the spot after a night of drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wK6nel-rmKjM7tOipvpaVg.text: Awesome Fried chicken place in Grand Bazaar Shop in front of Bally's on the strip.  Had the 4piece mix (Breast, wing, thigh and drumstick.  Sides of shoestring fries and coleslaw that were of the chain as well. 6 sauces to use, I had the BBRBBQ that was awesome. Tip, try the chicken without the sauce first.....crunchy and nice spiced and incredibly moist(see pictures)all for $17.95  You will not be disappointed, great chicken! I am a Fried Chicken Junky....so I know a good one when I see one...Great Service as well, Thanks Damon for free soda water as well!

PD5cAqw8SVX7If98K5Wj2A.text: The chicken was so tender and deliciously seasoned. Nice quick food while you're on the strip. Great dipping sauces available as well. It was nothing out of this world but definitely good.

PK5t10Y_SvTfXx3k_I8w_A.text: Since everyone was going crazy over this chicken, I figured I needed to try it! So, I brought my friend from out of town to eat for dinner.   The location itself is perfect if you're on the Strip. It's tucked away in the Bally's Bazaar. There are a few table seats and a bar seating area. It was relatively small, so we had to eagle-eye for a table. There was a sauce station in the corner and sauces on every table.   I ordered the AM-PM sandwich, which is the January special of the month. It was very good. The chicken was actually fantastic. It was extremely tasty and full of flavor.   The three star review is entirely because of the service. I would give one star for the staff, but the food was too good. So, they entirely messed up my order. I ordered the AM-PM sandwich, the Rancher, a side of corn bacon, a small beer, and a large drink. They gave me mac-n-cheese instead of the corn bacon. They charged me for a large beer ($15!) and forgot the large drink entirely, even though they charged me for it. I figured since the beer was already poured, I would just drink it. I mean, more beer is always fine with me. I think my friend got a different sandwich than he ordered, but he was fine with whatever at that point. The food took a long time, so I didn't even bother complaining about the mistakes in the food. Just not sure how so many things were incorrect from my order.   It was pretty expensive for being chicken sandwiches. The total for the above order was $45. However, I understand that it was on the Strip and the alcohol alone was $15. So, it was okay. I would say the prices are comparable for Strip prices. Just not sure I would pay for it again.   Overall, the food was great. Pricey, but great. The staff was very disappointing. I would give this place another shot but probably at the Summerlin location.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The AM-PM sandwich.
Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tTCH5_m0BgZfoSLgj5coVQ.text: Had such high expectations for this place for some evening munchies but was disappointed with the food and the service.   First, the staff is sooooo unorganized.  Everybody's orders took forever when all of the chicken was already made and sitting behind the counters! When we got to the counter the seemingly new and clueless counter girl told us we can only order chicken (because they were out of everything) when a fresh pan of fries literally just came out of the fryer.   This place touts its 12 piece tenders meal as enough to feed a family of four. Thinking they were large my friend and I ordered 2 to find that they were TINY. We also ordered a fried breast piece and the Pit Burger. The tenders and the breast tasted pretty good and were fairly crunchy but by no means lived up to any hype. Especially the teeny portions of the tenders. The burger was not great either... it was kind of overstuffed and the flavors didn't really work. It was too wet overall.   Disappointing experience to say the least given the 35+ minute wait with only 6 ppl ahead of us in line and all the chicken was premade..

A8fOjcfPXnrACAVWHzuXlA.text: Was looking for a foodie spot on the strip and this is the place! Chicken lover's dream with plenty of choices including signature sandwiches and unique dipping sauces to dip your chicken in. Loved the wasabi and chipotle honey very new experience in taste for me. The prices are great and the food is delicious they even have alcoholic shakes if you're into that!

2hNpoddPgmwJ6qRC_cWrwA.text: I had very high expectations of this place and that did not help...  The chicken was okay and not the best fried chicken I've ever had.  The best part about this place is the honey... lots and lots of honey.  Different kinds and no limits (other than it takes a long time to pour honey).  The fries were good (a great way to scoop up more honey) but oddly way more than you would need.  I will give it another chance, but I don't have high hopes that it will beat Yardbird for Fried Chicken on the Strip anytime soon...  Ordered: Kerry's Classic The Drum Line w/ Sweet Potato Fries (two drumsticks)  Overall: Worth the try because of the hype, but if you really just want Fried Chicken you might want to check out Yardbird instead

1iEesHzPRtphkuCwxeDPrg.text: I did not like it, the sandwich was dry, the chicken was kinda gross. The atmosphere wasnt that please tell, the workers seemed angry,  the fries were really good though, and I like the sauce selection. I'd probably go back and try it again if I'm around though.

8KhxB13V2E5QUaoJDmC8Mg.text: Marcus was super nice and professional. He told me to get two different items and they both were great. He was super cool and smiling

qTMLStrB9CIGz2Ji_80otg.text: It's on the strip but not, at the same time. Me and a few friends were looking for something new to eat after a long night and we came across the hidden gem. The menu is simple but that's what you need at a place like Vegas because you can easily get caught up with the glitz and glamour of Vegas lights and spend a paycheck on one meal.   I recommend this place to anyone wanted to get away from all the casino noise and cigarette smoke. Oh, the fried chicken is bomb! :-)

KTIVg7GkVgIJ6Xg_Lqt9Tw.text: Overall chicken was ok and the fries was awesome. I ordered the "beak to butt" which is supposed to be chef's choice. It basically has everything but chicken meat. I thought it'd be interesting to try other part of chicken fried. But, I was a little disappointed. The seasoning was good, but the chicken was too greasy. After a few bites I felt it was simply too much oil to eat. I had to throw out half of it. I'm curious to try other things on the menu, i.e. the ones with actual meat not the neck or butt.

0EDQpsNObD2ZRgupSRGT6Q.text: I was here on 1/25/2019 and got fried chicken to go. Once we got back to our hotel we realized that the chicken fries were so dry that it couldn't be swallowed comfortably. No condiments or napkins were included either. It seams like i might have gotten a bad batch based on other reviews, but I'm definitely not going back any time soon.

qF7tZ9RUz2YYVzD0ITQOlw.text: This chicken is so good !!!! I got the 4 piece to share between 2 people and it was enough especially if you've been drinking. Then the next day got the 2 piece with and extra wing added. It was great! Come with fries and coleslaw which is very tart and not to good.  Bf got the chicken sandwich he said it was great too. They have a spicy honey sauce Over the chicken. Can't wait to come back to Vegas to visit here again. Staff is super friendly. There's a red head girl she was some helpful and nice !!

JsTRRWm76F-GBD9cXbUT8g.text: This is by far the best tasting chicken I have had in Vegas or at least on the strip.  I had 3 piece wings and you could see the seasoning on the chicken.  It was friend to perfection where the meat just fell off the bones.  The service was great and the manager Marcus made it a point to add another wing to my oder because he though the 3 I had was in his eyes too small.  They close at 2:00 PM but if you get there before you can still sit inside and enjoy your food.  The habanero sauce is very runny but gives that perfect amount of heat when mixed with the ketchup or barbecue sauce.  Kudos for the blue ribbon I highly recommend and will definitely will return.  They also serve sides such as fries, fully loaded, mac & cheese etc.

hIurxSyKzjUcTZrf7GoaBw.text: I have been to Blue Ribbon in Vegas a couple times, and both times have gone for the chicken. They are known for their chicken, and they do not disappoint if you are looking for crispy juicy fried chicken. This time I tried their French fries, and they are killer! I will be visiting Blue Ribbon frequently when we are in Vegas!

xU-jUozJ4jEQKfRq5gcf4Q.text: Wasn't impressed with the chicken or French fries. Had to remind them about two separate parts of my order that they forgot. Was hardly busy. Would recommend the deep dish pizza place or the ramen near by.

2UebnH0n5bROXeBN690_5Q.text: The reviews way overhype this place. I ordered a two wing basket, added a small Mac and cheese and a medium drink for a tab of over $16. I'd say it was ok, but there must be better choices close by.  The chicken was tender and moist, but not freshly cooked or hit. Really barely warm. Whatever seasoning the sprinkle on it after it is cooked doesn't really help with the flavor. I ate the first wing plain. The second I used a couple of the sauces. I'd say these are mandatory because they add a lot. The honey chipotle was good.  I got lucky with the fries and caught a fresh batch. I noticed the cook just dumped the fresh over a large quantity that were already in the pan so in a few orders the people wouldn't be as lucky as I. The mac in the mac and cheese was perfectly cooked but I didn't care for the cheese at all and didn't eat much if it.  Decor is ok. Staff is listless and not too helpful. The people filling orders seemed clueless, I guess just bored.

LVXb114qMY_SA5ACl_f00A.text: Had very high expectations for this place. My friend and I got hungry at 12:00am after walking along the strip and decided what's better than some fried chicken! Well, let me tell you... The chicken is very bland, yes it was crispy but no flavor whatsoever. I got the Firebird sandwich and it was terrible. The chicken breast was very dry, not spicy at all. The bread was cold, the fries had probably been sitting there for a while since they weren't crispy at all. Just the overall service we received was poorly executed. Trust me when I say that the McDonalds spicy chicken sandwich tastes 10X better.

ImSDWWaevM1e9OI_fmYWyA.text: 27 years in Harlem N.Y. and a foodie!!! and this is THE best fried chicken I have ever had-too bad that I waited until the last days of our trip to Vegas-we ate all over the stripe and Blue Ribbon blew them away-we are talking about Caesars-Cosmopolitan-Bellagio-etc.-even the cole slaw was outstanding-nothing close in So. Fl. where we are now-Please BLUE ribbon open up in Palm  BEACH cOUNTY

_z3jRnjxNGRc3aXSfN61kQ.text: Best fried chicken I've had to date. The crispiness on the outside and juiciness on the inside with the perfect seasoning is the ultimate recipe. Vegas has so many great places to eat and I ate there 4 times in 3 days. Gonna miss you Blue Ribbon.

iRobYvq5xgw6vOECamp57g.text: Very good food, I had the firebird & the chicken breast was perfectly cooked, moist, juicy & flavorful! The toppings worked perfectly together. The shoestring fries are AMAZING too!

_DtGrHcSIwEdRxyRKlf_Aw.text: 9 dlls for a chicken sandwich, i expected more for that,we order 2 piece combo abd the sandwich, it took around 20 mins to get my food,service is crappy,sandwich cold,ask for easy ice on my drink,was my first time here,it will be my last.

WAej760yQARzFOCjUXUzGg.text: By far the Best meal in we had in Vegas and by far the best prices. If you are looking for a reasonable priced hometown home cooked meal with real people come here. I cannot give It higher recommendation. 10/10.

Obuuwozh60g2Y8L61Q5fug.text: Great fast option on the strip. Chicken sandwich was amazing. Small fry can easily be shared with another person (or two). Employees were extremely friendly. Would definitely come back again for another visit.

E81h6dhO8S8sr1-fBgDWdQ.text: Good little chicken spot located in the Grand Bazaar in Vegas. The sandwiches are big and  the mac'n n cheese is tasty. Great if you need a quick bite and a beer as you can order both in the Bazaar.

dfD2VxFzwBgckESBx-AVxA.text: I know fried chicken. The only thing I care about is what the actual fried chicken pieces are like. Not the sides. Not the tenders. Not the sauce. Just the pieces of chicken. Usually, fried chicken is not as good as Popeye's spicy white meat pieces. This place is an exception. Excellent breast and wings. Cooked well so that the meat is juicy. Skin crispy but sill attached. Well spiced. Pure fried chicken goodness.

XwUkDZF2uqK-1VJZIzR-XA.text: Very good and fresh food. You must try the pickled peppers. The staff was very courteous. My husband and I decided to try this place based on the yelp reviews and we weren't disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband and I shared The Royal Wing. The staff is very friendly and courteous.

ZXGrP9AysD0CgtLDKW_Bqg.text: This place is the best chicken spot that I have ever been to! The chicken is so flavorful. It's easily the best that I have ever tasted! Nothing is comparable. It is definitely a must try!

FnFRJuYlI7Hdux-MXEmKgQ.text: I came here for a yelp elite event a few weeks prior. The food was good. I appreciated the service, and the drinks were pleasant. So when I was asked what I wanted for dinner we were in the same vicinity so this place was an obvious choice to come back too. Now let's talk about the parking..... THERE AINT NONE. This spot is technically located in the Grand Bazzare Shoppes so to park anywhere near the place you would have to park in the parking garage at A) Paris Hotel  B)Bally's or C) do what we did and parked AAAALLL the way down the street for some free parking and spent a little bonding (walking) time getting to the place. Ha   Anyways it's located the farthest from the street and it's sort of tucked in the back so finding it is a little difficult. Considering I've been there before I knew exactly where it was with no problem. So when you walk in you go to the counter and order up there, they give you one of those beeper type of things to tell you when your order is ready and then you wait from there. The menu is very straightforward. Chicken, Chicken sandwhiches, Chicken tenders, Salad which you can add chicken too. LOL they had a few other things that could be customized but the general premise is the same. I ordered the two tenders and fries meal (8.95 ish) and normally for a few tenders and some fries I wouldn't spend 10 bucks but these things are HUGE and they pile the fries HIGH. Our wait wasn't too long and when it did come out it was piping hot. Like you could see the grease still popping on the tenders HOT. It came with a small side of cole slaw and on the table you have your options of loads of different sauces. My favorite is the chipotle honey mixed with hot sauce and some bbq sauce. Everything was great. The service was excellent. I swear the lady taking our order was so helpful to me and my friend. Explained everything, and was so patient with us.   Honestly I don't even think I finished my entire meal. (think they threw in an extra tender for our wait).My signs of a good restaurant experience is if I leave full and happy. Don't forget to check out their drinks too. I had a hibiscus margarita and it was tangy, crispy, and packed a decent punch. All in all. 5 star experience.

rHoWfIS8qQqryI6tAk6kVQ.text: Looking for a quick meal and decided to give it a try. The staff was very friendly even with the location being very busy. I only tried the tenders and fries. I found the tenders to be very dry, I am sure many people like them like this, just not my thing. Where they have it nailed for me is in the honey based sauces. WOW. I will be back to try some other menus items and update my review.

JC5ZmHzarUfxCRq_tGHPjA.text: You can't visit Las Vegas without getting some Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken!!!! It's so golden brown and seasoned by the gods!!!! I am definitely coming back here. It's not a big place and it's really busy but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f1CQyIScmi5HZGWwCqCJ8Q.text: Not good at all. Our party ordered a few different things. We ordered our chicken in my 4 piece mix, the only thing that was fresh and hot was the breast. Everything else was soggy and barely warm. None of the employees seemed to be excited to be there except for the guy cleaning in the dining area. It took 20 minutes to get our food, but only about 5 minutes for the rest of our party that ordered separately after us. We watched a few people that ordered their food after us get it before us.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TLjzDBE9Kr-Lr-HmHVWZlw.text: This place was a bit pricey but I believe worth the price.  Chicken was crispy, moist, meaty & delicious .  You are given a huge pile of hot crispy shoe string fries . Added flavor profile honey sauce at the table in squeeze bottles.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Ribbon Fried Chicken - Grand Bazaar - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dZxlQTXHIFoXacsFa7NXcg.text: It's a lot healthier than the other chicken sandwich places but still tasted really good. They have a large selection of sauces. fries were good

eDx4qAUNe_NhDSc-pyUw7A.text: The chicken wings were extremely small for the prices with no flavor or seasoning. The cole slaw was small but again no seasoning. The Mac and cheese was definitely cheesy but again no flavor. Overall, the menu is lacking flavor and seasoning!

DVCSTME_D4mkDgiyhgAqbQ.text: Quick stop on our way to planet Hollywood and it was amazing!!!! Thin, crispy fries and deliciously juicy fried chicken. Fantastic seasoning AND a wide variety of sauces on the side. The chipotle honey is a must try!

AYOm6KHeYDAIoSxEcvaD5Q.text: So this place is on my route to work & I follow the las Vegas hashtag on Instagram & I always see how lovely & photogenic the chicken  sandwich looks......  The photos don't do it justiceeeeee. Chicken was plump & juicy white meat, flavors were there lettuce was crisp.... Just a well put together sandwich to say the least.
